Opening Date: 18/02/2022 Closing Date: 18/03/2022 SecondMuse champions and supports the growth of future economies by designing and leading programs that involve workshops, events, mentorship networks, curriculum, and other efforts to build and grow community ecosystems. At the core of our community-sourced approach is a dedication to creating and fostering cohesive narratives and deep relationships throughout the ecosystem. We have organized innovation programs in over 100 countries and 250 cities, sourcing solutions from every corner of the world. Each program has challenged our teams to develop targeted approaches to find, and then support, visionary leaders with a diverse range of experiences, motivations and cultures. We invite you to help build with us--leverage our proven strategies to build strong communities and influence local, regional and global networks, and add your own contribution to our growing team and portfolio of programs. The Incubation Network is an impact-driven initiative that sources, supports and scales holistic innovative solutions to combat plastic pollution through strengthening entrepreneurial ecosystems with a diverse network of key partners. Part of a highly collaborative community of innovators, investors, partners and programs, The Incubation Network works together with industry players to tackle key barriers to address plastic leakage and advance a circular economy. This includes sourcing and supporting, to scaling early stage or pre-investment solutions, and connecting compatible ecosystem players to reinforce the value chain in waste management and recycling. Established in 2019, The Incubation Network is a partnership between non-profit organization, The Circulate Initiative and impact innovation company, SecondMuse. The Opportunity SecondMuse is seeking a contract Communications Junior Associate/Associate to support work on our program in South and Southeast Asia, The Incubation Network. This contract role reports to our SecondMuse Studio team that leads on marketing and communications for the whole company and across programs. The Communications Junior Associate/Associate will work primarily with the Studio team to support communications on multiple programs within The Incubation Network, but will also be embedded in the program teams to stay up to date on all of the program initiatives, milestones, and needs. The ideal candidate has good execution skills, a self-driven and high-energy individual who is result oriented and self-directed, with some experience in a marketing communications field. Essential Functions Support the day to day operations and content calendars of public-facing channels including website, newsletter, blogs and social media Support promotion of ongoing activities and programs on public facing channels Ensure standard and consistency in all program-related communications materials and deliverables Support content production including social graphics, copywriting for internal and external reports, creative briefs, presentations, blogs and thought leadership Maintain close communications with program teams to understand program updates, milestones and objectives Write, copyedit, proofread and revise communications content as necessary (blogs, articles, briefs etc.) Support SecondMuse Studio in the development of program-related communication plans Support Studio in partnership and client management for communications Support meeting facilitation and transcribe key meeting minutes Requirements Fluent in English with strong verbal and written skills Excellent organizational and time management skills An effective problem solver with good project management experience Ability to effectively manage client relationships and attentive to client needs Experience and openness to working with diverse range of people and teams Comfortable working across multiple teams and thrive in a collaborative work environment Work Environment This is a 1 year contractor position. This role requires working flexible hours across different time zones and occasionally on weekends. Our offices are currently closed due to COVID-19, therefore this contract role will be based remotely in Singapore. Education and Experience Experience comes in many different forms. At SecondMuse we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community of individuals with a wide range of backgrounds. At least a Bachelor’s Degree in Public Relations, Mass Communications, Media Studies, Journalism or any communications-related disciplines with 1 year of experience in corporate communications or marketing communications fields. Experience in public or private sectors, preferably in PR agencies, non-profit, sustainability or technology organizations highly preferred. To Apply Please send your resume with a cover letter via ‘Apply for this job’ or Workable. Thank you for your interest in joining our team and taking the time to apply for this position. While we are excited to receive your application, we are unable to respond to every applicant. Hence, only shortlisted candidates will be notified. SecondMuse provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. We strongly encourage applications from women and people of diverse sexual orientation, gender identity and expression and sexual characteristics.

Job_Title: Project Management Intern (CTO Office - Strategic Implementation), Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Project Management Intern (CTO Office - Strategic Implementation), Singapore ABOUT THIS ROLE We are looking for a motivated individual who is hungry to learn and thrives in a fast-paced environment. The person should have an eye for detail to ensure successful execution of projects, whilst having a creative spark to prepare effective communication materials. As part of the CTO office, the intern will help to plan and execute projects, alongside supporting strategic implementation of initiatives within the Engineering department. The intern will have the opportunity to (but not limited to): Work with Engineering lead(s) to ensure timely delivery of key projects / initiatives Facilitate effective communication with leaders / Engineering department via preparation of presentations and communication materials Assist in the operationalization of governance models, KPI dashboards, status reporting and tracking to drive key objectives and deliver outcomes This role will work closely with other teams (business, engineering etc) to deliver tasks on time The intern will have an opportunity to have a purview across the whole Engineering department This is an internship with a minimum duration of 3 months, 6 months is preferred. This is a group level role based in Singapore ABOUT CIRCLES LIFE Circles.Life is Asia’s first and most successful digital telco and we are on a mission to re-imagine the mobile experience for the digital consumer and disrupt the multi-trillion dollar industry. We launched our services in Singapore in 2016, and have since expanded to Australia, Taiwan, Indonesia and Japan. We are leading the market in innovation, customer satisfaction and growth. Circles.Life was founded by Rameez Ansar (ex-Temasek, BCG), Abhishek Gupta (ex-McKinsey, Bain Capital, StanChart PE) & Adeel Najam (ex- Nokia, Huawei, Starhub), who are supported by an all-star leadership team including C-suite executives from Tata Docomo, Paypal, Vodafone, Bharti Airtel, Hooq/ Singtel, and Flipkart (to name a few) It now employs 500+ people over 5 APAC offices. It is the portfolio company of Warburg Pincus and Sequoia Notable accolades from past years include: Top 5 most loved Singapore brands (2nd year running)- YouGov Customer's Choice; Top Telco for Customer Service- Seedly; and Top Employer- Influential Brands (2019) WHY THIS ROLE IS UNIQUE Build a legacy - Have the opportunity to work directly with Engineering leader(s) to leave an impact Create your own path - autonomy and freedom to define and be the one responsible to make it happen, whilst having the support and guidance from Head of Strategic Implementation Be at the position to witness and understand how leaders think WHAT YOU'LL DO Strategic Implementation: Trusted supporter who aids the Head of Strategic Implementation to focus on larger strategic Company and Engineering initiatives; contribute to ideation, planning, and execution of strategic projects across several areas Project Management: Integrate into the Engineering department and work with Engineering Managers to resolve barriers to the teams and projects; supports the operationalisation of governance model, KPI dashboards and assist in tracking timelines, resources etc to drive key objectives and deliver ambitious outcomes Communication management: Prepare and manage the execution of communication materials (e.g. presentations, emails, newsletter) to effectively communicate with internal Engineering department , or with the rest of the organisation WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH Head of Strategic Implementation Engineering leaders & teams WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR Current students, 3rd or 4th year, currently pursuing their Bachelors/Masters degree, or recently graduated / waiting to pursue further studies Min. 3-months (longer duration e.g. 6 months preferred) Motivated with a strong sense of ownership Solid organizational skills, including multitasking and time-management. Strong eye for detail and sense of urgency to ensure successful project execution Highly adaptable problem solver with a positive can-do attitude who likes fast paced environment! Proficient in Microsoft Powerpoint and Excel and/or Google Slide and Google Sheet Willing to roll up the sleeves and get on the ground to ensure smooth execution BENEFITS One of Circles.Life's key missions is to build the best place to work and grow. In order to do that, we offer: Exponential career growth & ownership - Completely own your own career and determine how fast and in which direction you grow. Being in a hyper-growth environment means having the opportunity for 10x the learning at 10x the speed; watch your role expand as the company expands. Impact from Day 1 - Translate idea to action and help us to blaze the trial for innovative products and shake up the telco world, and beyond. Talent Development - We stand for a culture of continuous learning and growing. Job_Title: Real Estate Portfolio Executive (Corporate Real Estate)
Job_Descriptions: JOB SUMMARY The purpose of this position is to Support the development of the Portfolio Management function, awareness, and understanding of the Financial institution (FI) with the Client and the on account CBRE Portfolio Management team. Interface directly with the Client to understand and interpret the Client’s needs, demands, and changes within their broader business environment, and investigate and advocate how CBRE can best support the Client. Continuously keep informed of new CBRE services, technologies, and market insights, and evaluate the opportunity of integrating these into the Client partnership. Work within the day-to-day operations of the Portfolio Management function within Singapore, ensuring they deliver to time all necessary reporting, transactions and financial reporting requirements. Main Objectives of the role Support where required in the recommendations and agreement on price caps with the Client Support, where required on the marketing of the Clients, owned portfolio - answer inquiries, Conduct site inspection as required Review proposals, negotiate with Tenant/Landlord, to achieve the best price and conditions for the Client in new leases, renewals, rent reviews Support in the review of proposals, negotiations with Tenant/Landlord, to achieve the best price and conditions for the Client in new leases, renewals, rent reviews for the retail and office network for any Transactions that fall within the Portfolio Management responsibility Where required notify the Client on expiring leases or upcoming rent reviews, advise the Client of its rights and obligations under the leases Support in the negotiation of termination and/or make-good obligations; Support in the negotiation of pay-out of lease residual, sublease and/or assignment to minimize dead rent and advise the implications of each option to the Client + surrender of leases from internal Client lets. Support in the review of contracts, seeking solicitor’s input and highlight any deviations or anomalies that may require engagement with the Client When required, ensure the timely return of cash security deposit when a lease has ceased Support in the preparation of annual budgets and participate in reviews for owned and/or leasehold commitments and if necessary, other periodic basis Establish and maintain good landlord-tenant relationships and where applicable Provide Support in the ATM batch approval process Reporting Update the Client's internal database and prepare reports for Finance, and Procurement's retention Communicate with Courier services for delivery Look after all Government, local authority billings and fill in standard forms (i.e. Government rates and Rents) Work with Client internal and prepare billing issues - for manual billing and new leases until automated. Consolidation of batch approval documents for submission to Business Unit. Process e-stamping of the Leases for the Client Update WIP and SharePoint on a regular basis Monitor potential upcoming tenders Any ad-hoc reports as required Requirement: A recognised Degree / Diploma in Real Estate, Facilities Management, Engineering, Business or related discipline A reasonable level of analytical Skills: qualitative and quantitative Able to work independently with minimal supervision Proactive self-starter Good attention to detail Time management skills: start to show understanding on how to manage concurrent tasks in parallel and prioritise accordingly Presents solutions to problems, escalating in a timely manner where necessary. Driving Customer Service Levels Proactively managing customer relationships Demonstrates excellent understanding of customer needs Reasonable presentation skills Sensitive to cross-cultural exposures Good communication (verbal & written) Ability to respond effectively to sensitive issues. Ability to write reports for submission to manager. Ability to discuss effectively with employees, management, and client groups to contribute to activities/workload underway. Ability to ensure contactability and respond to clients, landlords, and management on a timely basis

Life at Grab : At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia. Get to know the Team: The GrabMart Singapore team is responsible for driving one of the most exciting high-growth verticals within the company. We have primary responsibility over the overall direction of the business and hold full ownership of the business P&L. Our team is made up of a mix of experienced Grabbers from other verticals, and new hires from the Supermarket and eCommerce industries. If you are looking to be challenged and to work alongside inspiring teammates, this is the place to be! Get to know the Role: We are looking for a Demand Planning Lead who fulfils the requirements below. We are willing to exercise some exceptions for candidates who may not fit all requirements below but can demonstrate that they could still contribute meaningfully outside of the requirements below. If you believe you have what it takes then we’d love to hear from you. Key Responsibilities: Secure high level of stock availability by developing overall volume forecasts and anticipating key forecast changes to support the Merchandising team on inventory purchases. Design and execute initiatives aimed at improving forecast accuracy with the goal of achieving sustainable long term purchasing. Work with Finance to reconcile volume forecasts with financial forecasts and budgets, and ensure that risk & opportunity is balanced as part of the business planning process. Develop phase-in and phase-out strategy by working with the Merchandising team and other supporting stakeholders, and define clearance plans accordingly. Measure and report demand planning KPIs (forecast accuracy, out of stock %, shrinkage %, etc.) at weekly / monthly / quarterly frequencies and on an ad-hoc basis. Lead the buying team to ensure purchase orders are placed in a timely manner, and in accordance to the forecasts. Requirements: 4-6 years working experience in Grocery retail, FMCG or similar environment. Experienced in managing collaborative planning, forecasting and replenishment processes. Excellent command of written and spoken English. Proficient in Excel/Google sheets. Self-motivated and able to work autonomously with minimal instruction. Flexible and able to adapt quickly to changes in business needs and/or organisational processes. Able to take a joke and work with positivity! We are committed to building diverse teams and creating an inclusive workplace that enables all Grabbers to perform at their best, regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity or sexual orientation and other attributes that make each Grabber unique.

We serve to find, grow and keep the remarkable assemblage of talent who are our Grabbers. Get to know the Role: The People & Business Partner is responsible for aligning business objectives with key stakeholders and employees in designated business functions. Provides People expertise and counsel to management covering a full range of HR disciplines including organizational effectiveness, employee relations, performance management, career development, compensation and workforce planning. This regional position is based in Singapore. The day-to-day activities: Key responsibilities and scope include, but are not limited to: Shape Organization Culture Partners with leaders to translate insights from people dashboards into plans that will generate positive morale Works closely with business and employees to improve work relationships, build morale, and increase productivity and retention. Influence Organization Design & Structure Partners with the business on assessment of current state and future manpower requirement Provides guidance to managers on the justification of HCs and assessment of grades of these HCs Partners with leaders on drawing out the most optimum org structure that can support the current business requirement with the flexibility to adjust to future needs Execute talent management framework and processes to identify, develop and retain talent to meet present and future needs Recommend and deploy assessment tools to identify high-performing individuals Support organization learning needs Facilitates the learning needs analysis process in order to determine gaps, key developmental areas and liaise with Pops Learning Team and business to deliver appropriate interventions Performance Management Provide support to managers to cascade and communicate their key performance indicators to their team members and develop performance goals that are aligned to business requirements. Support & coach managers on how to have effective performance evaluation conversations Able to effectively facilitate calibration of ratings to ensure there is a uniform standard for performance across the organization Coach managers on how to structure performance improvement plans and then have effective conversations around improvement areas with employees Support managers on handling grievances that arises as a result of performance assessment outcomes of employees Partner across HR to deliver integrated solutions Educates and coaches managers on conducting effective assessment of potential hires Supports managers and partners with TA on appropriate positioning of compensation for selected candidates ensuring there is internal equity maintained Supports the assessment of cultural fit of candidates Partners with TA on communication of offer and closure of difficult offers Educates managers on merit planning process and provides advisory on the planning and execution Partners with Rewards to ensure the needs of the business is met Facilitate Change Management Help people understand why change is important using various communication medium, and operationalizes projects and initiatives as set forth by the higher-level plan Help shape the direction of change by identifying intended outcomes and steps for initiating change Applies flexibility to take feedback into consideration while implementing organizational change Be able to articulate the tensions between the need for change (flexibility, adaptability) and stability (standardization) appropriately Manage Employee Relations & Labour law compliance Serves as the HR subject matter expert to managers, and ensure that HR practices comply with government laws Applies experience and expertise to research solutions, and recommends policy changes to support business needs, and outline the business impact and risks in connection with labour relations, including ethical, legal and regulatory requirements, and oversees risk management issues Actively educate employees and managers on how to stay within legal guidelines regarding on-the-job behavior, investigate workplace violations, and respond to stakeholder queries though a combination of referring to internal experts, and/or interpreting both policies and changes to policy Manage employee exit processes, including conducting exit interviews, and individual communications (voluntary separation) to evoke positive pride of association with the organisation upon employee exits. Implements solutions for designation function/ department (including and not limited to conduct investigations of workplace policy violations) Grabber Data Management Perform & complete all Workday Business Process (from initiating new request to reviewing and approving process) in a timely manner Extract Workday reports to analyze workforce trends, track actual headcount vs budget, and use insights to appropriate action from stakeholders Keep abreast of changes in Workday business process and new module deployment in order to act as champion of Workday system Understand, use and master use of all People Operations Systems in order to maintain Grabber data accuracy Manage and/or coach people & team Influence and relate to others by awareness of how they come across to others, and acting with appropriate balance of confidence and humility Develops others by providing constructive feedback, guidance, and reinforcement to employees regarding job performance Drives results by accepting responsibility when missed deadlines impact major project outcome Business Partnering Demonstrates high level of emotional intelligence, insight into own behaviour /working style and emotional resilience Demonstrates personal credibility and impact by acting professionally, assertively, and authoritatively, articulating relevant past experience and success to instill confidence and trust in business unit/function Is able to influence internal stakeholders on a wide range of workforce issues and in different circumstances, with a focus on the impact on grabber experience, engagement, outcomes Uses a consulting approach with line managers and team to bring about positive impact in grabber experience, engagement and outcomes Execution & Delivery of People matters Demonstrates continuous development of relevant HR capability to deliver key business objectives Consistently delivers employment strategies, policies, plans and processes in line with HR practice model and achieve key business objectives Delivers HR policies, processes and procedures that are organisationally appropriate and supportive to line management Effectively and appropriately supports manager in key people management areas e.g. grabbers engagement, learning and development, health and wellbeing and performance management Able to develop and plan project plan, follow up on project performance and status. Workforce Planning Proposes, plans and executes Workforce Plan within the approved budget Identifies the data sources to gather and prepare relevant workforce data to perform workforce gap analysis Collaborates with business leaders to model and refine the current workforce profile, and project the future skills demand and supply. Rewards Conducts salary study to support recommendations on compensation structure that aligns to the industry range and meets the organisation’s financial budget Resolves issues or address questions related to payroll policies and procedures to ensure workforce are paid in accordance with agreed employment terms and conditions Develops knowledge to answer Grabbers' rewards-related questions The must-haves: A comprehensive and proven HR business partner experience in fast paced, collaborative working environment At least 7 years of relevant experience IT savvy, data driven Minimum Bachelor Degree Key Attributes & Skill Sets: Strong interpersonal skills and ability to communicate and team effectively at all levels Commercially astute to understand the business strategy in people terms and then determine how they can help deliver that strategy through targeted interventions, processes, policies, services and tools Insights led utilising data to reinforce decision making and drive interventions that link back to the overall business strategy goals, such as time hire, talent retention Coaching people across all areas in order to increase morale, accountability and clearer expectations Able to get the basics right quickly to earn credibility with stakeholders Proactive and do not wait for problems to resolve themselves which saves business units valuable time and risk Role model what is expected to support a more cohesive work and team environment Able to thrive in a VUCA (Volatile, Uncertain, Complex and Ambiguous) environment Self motivated, self confident, stress resistant Excellent English communication skills

Job_Title: Associate, Payments Operations (Drivers, Merchants, Corporate Partners)
Job_Descriptions: Get to know our Team: The Singapore Operations team oversees, shapes and grows the business in Grab Singapore. We contribute towards Grab’s vision of being Southeast Asia’s superapp by providing everyday services that matter most to consumers in Singapore. We develop and execute business strategies that help us achieve our vision in serving our community. As part of the Singapore Operations team, the Merchant and Payment Operations team work alongside the business verticals (GrabFood, GrabMart, GrabExpress, GrabforBusiness and GrabPay) to enable the various strategic initiatives and ensure the core operations continue to run smoothly. We are the voice of all types of merchants in Grab Singapore (e.g. GrabFood, GrabMart, GrabPay, etc) and we advocate for solutions that best meet their needs. This would require close collaboration with various cross functional teams e.g Regional, Finance, Product, Automation, Support teams. We also oversee the payment and fund flow operation processes across our various partners including drivers, merchants and clients in the different verticals. Get to know the Role : This role sits within the Merchant and Payment Operations team. We are looking for a strong candidate to manage processes which may affect payments and reporting to merchants. You will have the chance to work with the various cross functional teams in identifying gaps in existing process and support process experts, product managers in issue investigations, case escalations, or stakeholder feedbacks As we thrive in a fast-paced industry where we continuously realign business needs and seek new opportunities. This role has the opportunity to expand within the Merchant and payment operations team. The day-to-day activities : Deliver strategic projects by working closely with business owners and product managers to roll out new features and build payment operational processes Liaise closely with business lines to manage and ensure smooth fund flow to and from Grab’s merchant-partners Act as the voice of merchants and feedback internally to drive payments process excellence Manage Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) and monitor service standards of agents supporting the team’s daily operations through performance measurement and reporting General project management and reporting, collaborate extensively with stakeholders in different verticals Must-haves : Bachelor degree in a related area of study with strong academic credentials Minimum 4 years of relevant payments / operations project management experience, preferably working in fast and entrepreneurial environments. Process-oriented as well as strong organizational skills with a hands-on mentality Demonstrated ability in problem solving, structured thinking and decision making Customer centric mindset and the willingness to challenge the status quo High proficiency in Excel is a must Self-motivated, able to work independently and adapt to fast-changing dynamic, ambiguous  environments Have a positive attitude and can-do spirit, come across as fun, easy-going, vibrant, and creative Team player, excellent interpersonal & communication skills, good attitude Bonus points: Prior experience in digital payment landscape, online food, grocery delivery Accounting knowledge Python, SQL, R knowledge Working knowledge of software tools such as Salesforce, Zendesk, Tableau, Power BI Prior experience in internal controls/ audit

Minimum qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Law or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience in an Ethics & Business Integrity function in a multi-national company within the region. Ability to travel up to 25% of the time Preferred qualifications: Knowledge and understanding of basic finance concepts. Excellent people and communication skills, and ethical judgment. Strong understanding of ethics & compliance across APAC. About the job Google is an ambitious company. To push the limits of technology we have to take some bold steps. It’s the job of our Ethics & Compliance team to help us manage daring moves successfully. As a part of this group, you strive to identify risk in a non-traditional and ever-changing business. Your work allows us to navigate the uncertain aspects of our business future in creative ways that stay true to Google's high ethical standards. As part of a team of whip-smart lawyers, you are a self-driven team player who is able to collaborate with colleagues in person or remotely. In this role, you’ll also work alongside local partners to better understand–and address–their business needs while staying true to your mission. This is a fantastic opportunity for any lawyer who enjoys a challenge, who has strong interpersonal skills, and a thirst for learning as much as they can about the business they support. To push the limits of technology we have to take some bold steps. it’s the job of our Ethics & Compliance team to help us manage daring moves successfully. As a part of this group, you strive to identify risk in a non-traditional and ever-changing business. Google effectively and meaningfully fulfills its social responsibility by defining and shaping the culture of compliance and integrity. Office of Compliance and Integrity (OCI) uses its holistic and global capabilities to optimize consistency and calibration in managing compliance exposures across the company. The OCI International team is a close-knit team of lawyers and legal professionals who operate on a truly global stage. 20th century laws don't always solve 21st century problems, and Google Legal crafts innovative approaches for working with some of the toughest legal challenges of the information age. Whether you're a patent attorney, an intellectual property expert or an engineer headed to law school, Google Legal lets you address unanswered legal quandaries and create new precedents. Our innovative services raise challenging questions that demand creative and practical answers. We provide those answers by working at the crossroads of the law and new technology, helping Google build innovative and important products for users around the world. Resposibilities Localize global compliance policies and create Regional-specific policies where appropriate. Provide local law expertise on topics such as confidentiality, conflicts, anti-bribery, anti-money laundering, privacy and data protection, use of company assets, insider trading and compliance-related areas; retain local outside counsel where appropriate. Provide frequent and effective in-person training on our code of conduct and our compliance policies, including new employee orientation training. Assist headquarters compliance team in rolling out online training and be responsible for ensuring that the online training is applicable and appropriate for the Region. Perform periodic risk-assessments for the Region; inform headquarters of state of compliance in the Region.

Job_Title: Senior Financial Analyst, Google Customer Solutions
Job_Descriptions: Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field or equivalent practical experience 8 years of experience in the technology sector, strategy consulting, corporate finance, or similar industry in a commercially-focused, analytics-focused role Preferred qualifications: Proficient with SQL and spreadsheet/presentation software Ability to craft and deliver clear and concise messages to executive business leaders Ability to collaborate effectively with dispersed cross-functional teams Excellent communication and leadership skills Data analysis, strategic thinking, problem-solving, and financial modeling skills About the job Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. As a Financial Analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios or tracking performance metrics, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. While working on multiple projects at a time, you are focused on the details while finding creative ways to solve big picture challenges. Google Customer Solutions (GCS) works with businesses and ad agencies of all sizes. Our team partners with sales and cross-functional leadership to provide analytical insights and recommendations on key business decisions across the Asia Pacific region. In this role, you will work with sales leaders in Google Customer Solutions, act as a trusted advisor, and own end-to-end finance partnering on regional business priorities. The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business. Resposibilities Identify and evaluate emerging opportunities, develop business cases in partnership with cross-functional teams to enable investments and drive clarity and accountability on impact. Provide cross-functional executive management teams with clear and concise insights to make better business decisions, by communicating insights on complex, ambiguous topics. Collaborate closely with the GCS finance leadership and central finance teams. Engage and influence a wide range of stakeholders and executive leaders across Finance, Sales, and Strategy and Operations.

Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 7 years experience in an analytical role within a business finance or commercial function. Preferred qualifications: Experience in Consulting, Investment Banking, Telecommunications or Consumer Electronics. Excellent analytical, financial modeling, FP&A and/or project management experience with demonstrated process improvement. Ability to work in an unstructured environment and are comfortable dealing with ambiguity in a fast-paced environment. Understanding of accounting and finance operations. Distinctive problem-solving and analytical skills, combined with strong business acumen. demonstrated ability to multi-task and apply initiative and creativity on challenging projects. As a Financial Analyst, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios or tracking performance metrics, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. While working on multiple projects at a time, you are focused on the details while finding creative ways to solve big picture challenges. At Google, data drives all of our decision-making. As part of the APAC Finance team you will use data to inform strategic investments and product decisions across the company. Using your technical skills, business acumen and creativity, you will develop analysis and insights to help business partners understand key performance drivers and metrics, while providing recommendations to shape their investment decisions. The Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to senior leadership and is integral to helping grow scale and grow our Devices and Services business at Google. In this role, you will be plugged into framing the strategic and competitive position on executive-level deliverables such as sales productivity planning, business cases, strategic investment decisions etc. and will partner effectively with senior leaders across Marketing, Finance, Sales, and Product. you are a well-rounded top performer with strong communication skills, broad financial and analytical expertise and an ability to influence across these functions. Job Description - Engineer - Technician (HOT076BG) : Hilton Garden Inn Serangoon - Singapore 3 Belilios Road Singapore 219924 An Engineer/Technician will support the Engineering Team to efficiently maintain all hotel operations such that safety, security, conversation, and compliance are ensured at the highest levels. What will I be doing? As Engineer/Technician, you will support the Engineering Team to ensure that engineering and maintenance operations within the hotel, including general property maintenance energy conservation, are working properly and to standard. You are also responsible for the development of the Engineering Team and staying abreast of compliance regulations and procedures in the field of Engineering, as required for hotel standards. Specifically, an Engineer will perform the following tasks to the highest standards: Perform day-to-day routine and preventative maintenance within the hotel rooms Respond promptly and efficiently to any maintenance calls that arise Execute the preventative maintenance schedule and ensure all equipment and designated areas are maintained to the required standard Assist in the implementation of energy conservation program Recommend maintenance system improvements and energy savings Maintain all tools, equipment, and working areas in good condition Keep your technical training knowledge and skills up to date What are we looking for? An Engineer/Technician serving Hilton brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviours, skills, and values that follow: A certificate in a specialized field such as Electrical, Mechanical, Refrigeration, Carpentry, or Plumbing, required Current working knowledge of general maintenance and engineering work Experience in the Maintenance Department of a large hotel, hospital, ship, and/or restaurant complex or similar Strong work ethic A passion for delivering great customer service Ability to work without close supervision and within established timeframes What will it be like to work for Hilton? Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands.  Our vision “to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality” unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day.  And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all! : Full-time Brand: Hilton Garden Inn : Day Job : Team Member : Engineering, Maintenance and Facilities

Job_Title: Digital Manager, Marketing and Content, Honeycombers
Job_Descriptions: Honeycombers is Singapore’s leading premium lifestyle platform, with a highly engaged readership who come to us for the latest in dining, beauty, fashion, attractions, what’s on and more. ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES The Digital Manager, Marketing and Content is responsible for developing and implementing digital strategies for client campaigns and delivering digital solutions that meet clients’ objectives. Working closely with the Digital Marketing and Content team, to facilitate the digital process for clients, including: Liaising with clients for materials, approval, fulfilment of advertising campaigns including project management and client services. Managing client communications to ensure that media contracts are fulfilled in a timely fashion. Managing a range of clients, ensuring an end to end account management and campaign optimisations. Building and maintaining strong client relationships through a good understanding of the client’s business (brand and corporate). Facilitating day-to-day project timeline management for all client’s campaigns. Setting up and monitoring the performance of client’s campaigns across digital platforms. Assisting with the daily update to track the fulfilment of campaigns. Flagging issues, problem-solving, and keeping abreast of digital trends across the locations we operate in. Coaches and assesses the performance of the Digital Executives, Marketing and Content. To increase the performance of our campaigns through precision & strategic FB boosting and increase client retention through client rapport. Ensuring all clients receive detailed campaign reports with qualitative and quantitative analysis of the campaign performance. To mentor and train the team in best practices and create/update SOP documents. Manage campaigns performance, optimise campaigns, manage split testing, and suggest campaign changes to increase the performance of campaigns. Manage delivery, optimisation, reporting for clients. Recommend suitable content angle to all markets. Keep abreast of changes in the digital marketing and content landscape, and implement any new ideas or strategies to help the success of the business across markets. REQUIREMENTS AND KEY SKILLS Minimum 4 years digital operations experience from an agency, media or related company Exceptional organisational skills Leadership qualities and experience managing a team Strong client relationship management skills Our Values Like all good companies, we value inclusion, respect and all other kinds of ethical behaviour. Alongside these, there are five values we prize and actively look for in staff and candidates: Impact - We have a strong influence and impact on our audience, our clients and our wider community. We make a real difference. We take special pride in what we do and only write about things we believe in, and we’re constantly working to bring you the latest and raddest happenings around town, even if it means frequent hangovers (we’ll take one for the team). Integrity - We want to do things that make our kids proud. We are honest and have strong moral principles. Teamwork - Nothing works unless there is teamwork. We work together, collaboratively as a team, to achieve our goals. Our team has a growth mindset, and we look to reach more people through innovative content. Love Local - We celebrate local designers, creators, producers and businesses. We want to use our powers to lift them up. Fun - We are playful, we have good humour (well, we love a joke or two) and we enjoy having a sense of fun at work. We’ll be honest: we love our jobs, and we want to find the right candidate that will love working with us too.

Your Job Responsibility Leading or managing key projects including, but not limited to, drafting ESG/Sustainability related policies; carbon accounting and climate neutral initiative; annual sustainability reporting; internal reporting; staff volunteering activities. Engaging with relevant stakeholders including shareholders/investors; stock exchange; rating agencies; NGOs; industry organizations; government agencies. Monitoring ESG related regulations in relevant jurisdictions (e.g. ESG reporting requirements; Taxonomies) and for formulating solutions to comply. Researching ESG and industry issues. Representing Traveloka in ESG/sustainability forums, conferences and industry organizations. Conducting internal awareness sessions and trainings on ESG issues. Our Ideal Candidates 5 to 8 years of experience in the sustainability/ESG space. Experience in or knowledge of ESG issues in the following industries: IT / software and services / consumer tech / e-commerce; airlines; hotels; food. Deep Knowledge of ESG issues such as climate change, science-based and net zero targets; data privacy and security; digital inclusion; gender diversity; sustainable tourism; deforestation; plastic pollution; water scarcity and pollution. Experience in ESG research and rating methodologies. Experience in sustainability/ESG reporting and in reporting requirements and standards (e.g. SASB, GRI, TCFD). Experience in climate accounting and carbon neutral labelling. Strong analytical skills and Excel skills. Strong project management and execution skills. Willingness to lead several projects simultaneously and to work independently and with little supervision. Strong ability to engage with and present to senior management and broad audiences. Willingness to engage with different teams across the organization and with a wide range of external stakeholders. Proactive in raising issues and in solving them. Pragmatic, proactive, doer and result-oriented, honest and fair, positive mindset. Apply Now and Join Us Traveloka is Southeast Asia’s lifestyle superapp with a mission to fulfil the travel and lifestyle aspirations of our users. Founded in 2012 by ex-Silicon Valley engineers, we set out to solve a central problem: simplifying travel from Indonesia to the world. That’s how we became Indonesia’s leading travel platform but today we are so much more. Our suite of products and services – spanning travel, local services and financial services – provides our users with an end-to-end solution for their travel and lifestyle needs. From transportation to accommodations, attractions to eateries, and insurance products to financial services, we want to empower the region’s fast growing and highly aspirational consumers to enjoy new experiences and explore the world around them.

Job_Title: Sr Mgr, IT Workflows Solution Consulting
Job_Descriptions: Company Description ServiceNow is making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud‑based platform and solutions deliver digital workflows that create great experiences and unlock productivity for employees and the enterprise. We're growing fast, innovating faster, and making an impact on our customers' and employees' lives in significant and important ways. With over 6,900 customers, we serve approximately 80% of the Fortune 500, and we're on the 2020 list of FORTUNE World's Most Admired Companies.® We’re looking for people who are ready to jump right in and help us build on our incredible momentum, our diverse, engaged workforce, and our purpose to make the world of work, work better. Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow. Job Description Company Work matters. It’s where we spend a third of our lives. And the workplace of the future is going to be a great place. We’re dedicated to bringing that to life for people everywhere. That’s why we put people at the heart of everything we do. Team People matter. Our people have a passion for learning, building, and innovating. Whether you’re an engineer, a sales professional, a finance professional, or anything in-between, our roles aim to provide each person with meaningful impact and plenty of space to grow Role ServiceNow is seeking a Solution Consulting Manager to build a high performing team of pre-sales Solution Consultants and Architects in our rapidly expanding APJ IT Workflows specialist team which cover IT Operations Management, IT Business Management, IT Asset Management, Security Operations, Governance Risk & Compliance portfolio of products. This is your chance to get in front of developing your own team in a fast-paced environment.  The Solution Consulting Manager is responsible for individual Solution Consulting career planning and development, team development and hiring according to the dynamic needs of the sales organisation, and other administrative duties relative to team management. Solution Consulting Manager is expected to maintain strong relationships with counterparts in the Sales, Services, Support, Marketing and other organisations to ensure alignment of organisational activities and directions. These responsibilities all directly support the Solution Consulting Manager's primary goal: developing and maintaining a team that consistently secures the technical win in every deal they support for the sales teams. The role will report into the APJ IT Workflows Solution Consulting Senior Director. What you get to do in this role: Understand the needs of the Asia and India sales organisation and develop plans to ensure outstanding support of those needs. Focus on strategic sales opportunities Represent the IT Workflows business at company and industry events via collaboration with our marketing and communication functions Create solutions which show the broader value of IT Workflows especially in conjunction with strategic partners Develop team members according to the demands of the business and according to their individual professional goals Develop and maintain a recruiting pipeline of potential Solution Consulting candidates to meet future business demands Work with our sales directors to prioritise regional Solution Consulting efforts Assign resources to sales opportunities, and consistently evaluate progress against goals Assign resources as required to marketing and other efforts to support demand generation Develop and deploy team training curriculums to meet the changing demands of the sales organisation Evaluate team members regularly through analysis of direct observation, peer feedback and sales feedback Ensure proper alignment of resources and effective utilization of skill sets within the assigned region Manage day-to-day activities such as resource scheduling conflicts, expense review and approval, activity reporting etc. Qualifications In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who has: 3 – 5 years of team leadership and management of a pre-sale’s organisation experience a must C-level presence.  Ability to deliver business value message in front of executives on the value proposition of ServiceNow Platform Demonstrated ability to lead projects to completion.  Ability to execute business initiatives aligned to the global IT Workflows business Pre-sales experience, create and contribute to sales campaigns focused on general IT Management activities Experience working in one of the following domains – IT Operations or Security Operations Experience with the ServiceNow product suite or competitive product suites highly desirable Able to articulate and logically communicate concepts with technical and non-technical audiences Ability to run hard and act fast, we are looking for people who can drive our business to the next level.  We are looking for leaders who can lead by example especially with technical solution proposals A solid professional network to help hire, train, and grow the team We provide competitive compensation, generous benefits, and a professional atmosphere. This is a very collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented developers in the business. All genuine ServiceNow job postings can be found through the ServiceNow Careers site. Work personas Work personas are categories that are assigned to employees depending on the nature of their work. Employees will fall into one of three categories: Remote, Flexible or Required in Office. Required in Office A required in office work persona is defined as an employee who is contracted to work from or aligned to a ServiceNow-affiliated office. This persona is required to work from their assigned workplace location 100% of the work week based on the business needs of their role. Flexible A flexible work persona is defined as an employee who is contracted to work from or aligned to a ServiceNow-affiliated office and will work from their assigned workplace location roughly 3 days/week or less (generally around 40-60% of the work week). Flexible employees may choose to work the remaining working time from their workplace location or home. Flexible employees are required to work within their state, province, region, or country of employment. Remote A remote work persona is defined as an employee who performs their responsibilities exclusively outside of a ServiceNow workplace and is not contracted or aligned to a ServiceNow-affiliated office, including those whose place of work (pursuant to their terms and conditions of employment) is their home. Remote employees are required to work within their state, province, region, or country of employment.

Executive Editor (Commentary), CNA Digital CNA Digital is looking for an executive editor to help drive its daily commentary offering, by working closely with editors and commentators to develop content that is memorable, incisive, engaging and timely to a growing international audience. You will be expected to: Help to conceptualise compelling and insightful commentaries that both react quickly to the news cycle as well as set the agenda by providing analysis and focus on developing local and international issues. Cultivate, manage and work with a diverse stable of commentators both external and internal, who can meet the highest levels of CNA’s editorial standards, and who can provide a range of opinions and astute insights. Commission, schedule and edit daily commentary pieces, as well as write one on occasion, and ensure their amplification through strategic crafting of headlines and blurbs. Keep a finger on the pulse of what issues matter to CNA’s audience, through attention to data analytics and social listening posts. Requirements: At least 10 years of working experience in journalism, public policy or academia, with at least four years of running a team in a fast-paced environment. A well-rounded understanding of a wide spectrum of global and local issues - able to toggle easily between business, geo-political, social, cultural and public policy topics - with a knack for knowing how to turn those issues into interesting commentary and analysis. Be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, and have an intrinsic knack for knowing which conversations matter, and the questions that may emerge from breaking news. Excellent writing skills with strong editing ability to identify shortcomings in argument, language, style and flow. Must be able to work closely and collaboratively with external contributors and the CNA Digital news teams. A wide professional network to draw on for a broader range of commentary contributors. Be able to drive distribution and amplification via various platforms, such as social media and messaging apps; and understand how to use data analytics to help shape and improve offerings. Strong leadership, interpersonal and organisational skills. Established in 2020, the Singapore Studio is Riot’s second international game development studio. Working together with our Hong Kong Studio, Riot has been expanding our footprint in Asia and accelerating our talent growth to develop games that deliver great experiences to our players. Our mission is to “scale Riot’s games to hyper-serve players.” We partner with our LA headquarters on game development for League of Legends, Teamfight Tactics, and Legends of Runeterra. We’re also building teams for VALORANT and Project L, our take on a fighting game. The Singapore Studio is seeking talented, passionate Rioters with backgrounds in all areas of game development to build games that make it better to be a player. We’re focused on working together to promote individual autonomy, ownership, collaboration, and inclusivity, so every Rioter can be their best while we boldly pursue games. That’s where you come in. Responsibilities Develop a vision for Data Discipline in Hong Kong and Singapore Studio with the team and partners including the Technology, Product, and Process Leads. Translate the vision into solid strategy including the reallocation of resources to focus on the right priorities. Own the strategy execution aspects ranging from hiring to cross-company alignment. Cooperate with the studio's key initiatives with targeted innovation while avoiding disruptions in the current production. Identify and drive high-value long-term R&D type opportunities Recruit, hire, manage, and mentor team members to help your team scale Required Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field or equivalent practical experience M.S. in Machine Learning, AI, Statistics, Math, or related Computer Science/Quantitative field with 4+ years of industry experience, or equivalent experience (i.e., Ph.D. with 2+ years relevant experience, or B.S. with 6+ years relevant experience) Have worked as a Senior Data Scientist/Senior Data Engineer or higher History of building reliable, scalable, and maintainable systems. Experience developing and deploying Machine Learning models at scale. Experience collaborating across departments to create solutions. Experience in researching innovative Machine Learning opportunities to drive innovation, efficiency and productivity. Our Perks Full relocation support Full health insurance for you, your spouse and children Open paid time off Retirement benefits with company matching Life insurance, parental leave, plus short-term and long-term disability Play Fund so you can broaden and deepen your knowledge of our players and community through games We will double down on your donations of time and money to non-profits Don’t forget to include a resume and cover letter. We receive a lot of applications, but we’ll notice a fun, well-written intro that shows us you take play seriously.

Carousell is the leading classifieds group in Greater Southeast Asia on a mission to inspire the world to start selling, and to make secondhand the first choice. Founded in August 2012 in Singapore, the group has a leading presence in eight markets under the brands Carousell, Mudah.my, Cho Tot, OneKyat and Ox Street, serving tens of millions of monthly active users. We have three technology development centres in Singapore, Taiwan and India, as well as offices in Hong Kong, Malaysia, Philippines, Indonesia, Myanmar, and Vietnam. Carousell is backed by leading investors, including Telenor Group, Rakuten Ventures, Naver, STIC Investments and Sequoia Capital India. As a team of passionate individuals working together to solve meaningful problems, there is so much more for you to discover in a career with Carousell. Our culture is made up of hiring, developing, and promoting people who embody our values of solving problems for our users; having a mission-first mindset; being relentlessly resourceful; caring deeply; and staying humble to constantly improve. Together as an organisation, we make magic happen. Carousell’s product managers lead this exciting mission by redefining what online classifieds can be—smart, convenient and community-focused. We constantly look at data and talk to our users to understand what they’re doing, thinking and feeling along their user journey and empathise with their needs. This user-centric approach guides us in crafting the best user experiences. Verticals - Services, Autos, Property Buying and selling in Verticals, such as Autos and Property, is very different from buying a second hand dress or selling your kid’s old toy. To provide a great experience for car buyers, sellers and dealers, property buyers, sellers, agents and developers, services buyers and small businesses providing services, etc it’s important to understand the nuances of these markets, and build products and user experiences that cater to them. This team has to balance between solving specific problems and also generalising these solutions across categories to create more impact, and to create a coherent product experience. Verticals are also very important for sustainability and success of the business - a significant percentage of revenue of general classified marketplaces around the world comes from verticals. About the role We are looking for an experienced Senior Product Manager to join us in Singapore or India on this exciting journey.  In this role, you will lead most product initiatives hands on, in addition to mentoring 1 junior PM. You will partner with a talented team of Software Engineers, Designers, Data Scientists and Analysts, other Product managers, and have ownership of Verticals products at Carousell. You will be responsible for Autos, Property buyer and seller experience, including private and professional sellers This includes Verticals search and discovery, listing details, buyer/seller communication, listing creation, vertical pro seller tools and partnerships. You’ll also take on inventing transactional vertical products that go beyond the traditional classifieds lead based models. You will: Define strategy and vision for Verticals Experience, working with other PMs and business stakeholders Combine usage data, market and user research, and industry best practises to understand the domain deeply and identify user problems and breakthrough opportunities Lead product discovery with designers, engineers and business stakeholders to identify and solve for user value, usability, technical and business risks. Transform user problems into validated solutions using technology, data science and analytics, support processes and marketplace policies. Ruthlessly prioritize, drive stakeholder alignment, proactively manage risks & dependencies. Drive product launches, partnering with business stakeholders to prepare high quality training plans, branding and marketing materials, and user communication. Measure impact of initiatives, decide and communicate success or failure, identify key learnings and integrate them in overall user, product & feature understanding. You have: User obsession and empathy. Focus on impact and results. You work on the right things and get them done. Drive and resourcefulness to persevere and overcome obstacles achieving challenging goals. Strong product and business judgement. Willingness and ability to take smart risks and fail forward. Track record of successfully solving complex and ambiguous problems. High integrity and ability to positively collaborate with others Ability to think, speak and write succinctly and clearly. Analytical skills to understand & generate insights from user data. Fluency querying and working with data. Familiarity with agile development processes and Rapid product development techniques, such as Design sprints, Story mapping and others 7+ years of industry experience, including 5+ years of Product Management experience, preferably in a customer/user facing organization Bachelor’s degree, with strong academic record, in Computer Science or a related field such as Math, Physics, Engineering, Finance, Economics, or Business Administration. Masters preferred. By clicking on Submit, you are accepting to our PDPA policies. Carousell is the leading classifieds group in Greater Southeast Asia on a mission to inspire the world to start selling, and to make secondhand the first choice. Founded in August 2012 in Singapore, the group has a leading presence in eight markets under the brands Carousell, Mudah.my, Cho Tot, OneKyat and Ox Street, serving tens of millions of monthly active users. We have three technology development centres in Singapore, Taiwan and India, as well as offices in Hong Kong, Malaysia, Philippines, Indonesia, Myanmar, and Vietnam. Carousell is backed by leading investors, including Telenor Group, Rakuten Ventures, Naver, STIC Investments and Sequoia Capital India. As a team of passionate individuals working together to solve meaningful problems, there is so much more for you to discover in a career with Carousell. Our culture is made up of hiring, developing, and promoting people who embody our values of solving problems for our users; having a mission-first mindset; being relentlessly resourceful; caring deeply; and staying humble to constantly improve. Together as an organisation, we make magic happen. About the role We are looking for a senior product leader to join our tech leadership team and take ownership of classifieds monetization product domains for Carousell’s marketplace with our Classifieds business unit: Paying and Pro Users, and Verticals. This business unit is responsible for most of the revenue generated from our classifieds marketplaces. Paying Users Carousell helps different segments of sellers sell with ease - ranging from individuals to more frequent casual sellers to professional business owners and merchants. We offer these users a suite of paid products to improve their chances of success, and grow and manage their business. These products include advertising tools to promote listings, target specific audiences and manage sales and customers on Carousell. The charter is to maximize success of these paying sellers while ensuring a great buyer experience as well. Verticals Buying and selling in Verticals, such as Autos, Property and Services, is very different from buying a second hand dress or selling your kid’s old toy. To provide a great experience for car buyers, sellers and dealers; property buyers, sellers, agents and developers; services seekers and small businesses providing services, it’s important to understand the nuances of these verticals, and build products and user experiences that cater to them. The charter is to grow our vertical marketplaces, delighting all segments of buyers and sellers, and to grow revenue by sharing in value created with the relatively higher proportion of professional sellers in these categories. You will lead a lean team of 4 product managers responsible for these domains, partnering closely with business unit heads, as well as engineering, design and data leaders. The role is based in Singapore and reports to the CTO. You will: Lead product strategy and collaborate on business strategy with stakeholders Attract, coach and retain empowered product managers, who enjoy working in innovation, user-focused solutions, and thrive in a fast paced, fun environment Inspire the team to dream big and innovate to delight users Foster a culture of continuous improvement through mentoring, feedback and metrics Set clear measurable goals for your product managers and the tech teams of designers, engineers, data scientists and analysts they work with Combine usage data, market and user research, and industry best practises to understand the domain deeply and identify user problems and breakthrough opportunities Work with a diverse set of internal and external stakeholders to quickly build products and services that create significant value for users and revenue for the company Champion product management functional excellence across Carousell Attitude and behaviours critical to success To be successful in this role you must be dedicated to Carousell’s mission and care deeply about our users. In addition to focusing on flawless execution you will have high energy, intellectual curiosity, and a proven track record of delivering results. When data is not available, you must rely on your instincts and judgment to make high quality decisions quickly. You will have demonstrated: User obsession and empathy. Drive and resourcefulness to persevere and overcome obstacles achieving challenging goals. Focus on impact and results. You work on the right things and get them done. Exceptional product and business judgement. Willingness and ability to take smart risks and fail forward. Strategic awareness, financial fluency and a strong understanding of a profit and loss account. Track record of successfully solving complex and ambiguous problems. High integrity and ability to positively collaborate with others Ability to think, speak and write succinctly and clearly. Analytical skills to understand & generate insights from user data. 10+ years of industry experience, including 7+ years of Product Management experience, preferably in a customer/user facing organization Bachelor’s degree, with strong academic record, in Computer Science or a related field such as Math, Physics, Engineering, Finance, Economics, or Business Administration. Masters preferred. Good To Have People management and development experience with geographically distributed, remote teams By clicking on Submit, you are accepting to our PDPA policies. Headquartered in New York City, Dataiku was founded in Paris in 2013 and achieved unicorn status in 2019. Now, more than 900 employees work across the globe in our offices and remotely. Backed by a renowned set of investors and partners including CapitalG, Tiger Global, and ICONIQ Growth, we’ve set out to build the future of AI. Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modelling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation. We are seeking a Sales Enablement Business Partner to join our team in APAC. Reporting to the Sales Enablement Manager, the Sales Enablement Business Partner will ensure that effective selling doesn’t happen by chance - it is formulaic. The Sales Enablement Business Partner will contribute to the success of the Account Executive and Inside Sales teams by providing them with all the relevant (localized) training and content they need to sell Dataiku. There is a lot for the Account Executive and Inside Sales teams to know and master, it is the job of the Sales Enablement Business Partner to bring focus and intention to learning. This is a highly visible individual contributor position where quality, clarity, and scalability are paramount to the candidate’s success. You must be willing and able to partner with your stakeholders (revenue leadership) to ensure the effective enablement of teams on the ground What you will do: Overseeing and owning the enablement strategy/program of APAC Account Executive and Inside Sales teams with the objective of improving sales efficiency in their revenue growing and pipeline efforts. Build a culture of Feedback and drive desire for enablement and learning across leadership Help sales managers build a healthy pipeline by building and providing relevant training and content Attend sales team meetings in your region in order to understand where to focus your efforts in upcoming training Coach Account Executive and Inside Sales teams during 1 on 1 session (shadowing calls, practicing pitching, role plays, review messaging…) Partner with the BDR Productivity Manager to build a library of excellence (discovery calls, outreach sequences, snippets, videos) Planning, scheduling, and facilitating elective/sequenced training, and 3rd party vendor training, whether in-person or virtual Tracking and measuring the effectiveness of all initiatives (training and content) and providing actionable insights and feedback to Global Sales Enablement Maintain updated training content in a Learning Management System (LMS), where appropriate 25% Travel

Job_Title: Intern, Government and Public Affairs, APAC
Job_Descriptions: Are you keen to be part of the Government and Public Affairs (GPA) Team in one of the fastest growing regions in a company that thrives on its values of “Imagination, Creativity, Fun, Learning, Caring and Quality”? We are hiring for an internship with a minimum commitment of 3-6 months. Please indicate your available dates in your Cover Letter and submit your CV together with unofficial transcripts. Core Responsibilities • Support the Asia Pacific Government Affairs team to execute ambitious public policy deliverables. Help senior public policy leads of policy workstreams across market access, Intellectual Property rights, Operations and Sustainability drive their advocacy agenda with policymakers in the region • Coordinate policy submissions, events and other stakeholder management tasks. Help develop an information management system • Coordinate GPA team activities, support our policy agenda with external channels including but not limited to social media Play your part in our team succeeding At the LEGO Group, our mission is to inspire and develop the builders of tomorrow. In Government & Public Affairs, we do this by enabling the LEGO Group and LEGO branded entities to thrive and grow through strategic engagement with governments and related partners; growing market opportunities, protecting our business from political and legislative risk, and enhancing our reputation. We work towards a favorable legislative and regulatory environment through comprehensive issues management ensuring no surprises to the operating model. We deliver a public affairs program that builds reputation, goodwill and political capital with regulators, politicians, interest groups, NGOs and the local communities establishing the LEGO Group as a leader in the toy industry as well as a global leader in Learning Through Play. When you join our team and this position, you will have an opportunity to learn how to anticipate, counsel and shape the public policy agenda that will impact the LEGO Group’s supply chain and operational growth. Do you have what it takes? • Currently enrolled and completing Bachelor’s Degree or Master’s Degree (preferred) in Public Affairs/ Public Policy/ Political Science or related fields • Self starter and passionate about government affairs, policy and public affairs • Hunger to learn, absorb and drive for self development • Strong organisational skills • Strong team player and collaborator • Tech savvy • Strong English language skills (spoken and written) to collaborate with colleagues globally • Proficiency in an additional Asian language would be a plus to support APAC region Join the global LEGO® team What’s in it for you? Here are some of what to expect: • Family Care Leave – We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times. • Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind. • Wellness – We want you to be your best self, so you’ll have access to the Headspace App and lots of wellbeing initiatives and programmes run by local teams where you are based • Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount. • Your workplace – Our offices will be your primary workplace with flexibility to work from home during your working week. About Us Dyson is a global technology enterprise. We solve the problems others choose to ignore, with surprising new inventions that defy convention and simply work better. We’re driven by progress and thrive on the challenge of relentless improvement. We’re growing fast and our ambition is huge – more categories, more locations and more people.About the Role The Regional Head of Facilities will be leading a team of Senior Managers, Engineers and Professionals in SEA. Responsibilities: Oversee the operation and maintenance of the workplaces in APAC countries. Ensure the facilities services and buildings or offices meet operations requirements and in best-in-class conditions. Oversee the soft and catering services to ensure service providers meet Dyson’s high standards in cleaning, vector control, landscaping, transport, canteen operation and food quality. Work with service providers on regular cost and quality improvements.  Oversee the hard services to ensure building, compound and fixtures, and all plant equipment are maintained at optimum performance level. Track their performance and capacity utilization regularly. Responsible for small project works. Collaborate with other functions to meet security, safety, environment and health compliances. Manage property / facilities related procurement, license / permit renewal, cost management, visitor management and end-users’ work requests are satisfactorily completed.   Support troubleshooting of complex technical problems and provide suitable solutions. To present issues and solutions senior management, and to justify the resources to rectify the issues.   Upkeep the standard operating procedures to ensure Code, ISO and Dyson’s standards compliances. Responsible for people training and development. Motivate and nurture the people. Promote collaboration and teamwork. Lead best practices and lessons learnt sharing, as well as standardizes processes and procedures across all sites in APAC. Review and justify Capex and OPEX submissions for APAC. Effectively coordinate with local stakeholders on operations, projects and facilities' programs to ensure smooth delivery, transparency and consistency Act as an advisor and advocator of effective industry practices and best-in-class practices. Strive to achieve the best-in-class standard. Support other region’s work requests when called upon. About You Essential: Master or Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or Facilities Management from a reputable University. At least 15 years of working experience in Facilities / Estates job responsibilities, and minimum 5 years of working experience in leadership job role. Working experiences in Asia is preferred. Willing to travel overseas for work assignments. Highly proficient in systematic problem solving and process control techniques like 8D report, FMEA, SPC and predictive maintenance program.
