Overview As a Senior Operations Manager, you will lead a complex and innovative projects in marketing with severe changes. Manage your own project team, including setting strategic direction. Formulate the project plan, in accordance with goals and timing, set by management; specifies the manning of the project, resources required, anticipated costs and assesses risks. Control the project budget and project progress, evaluates project initiatives as to feasibility, costs/benefits and added value, and takes corrective actions when necessary. Lead the project within the project budget and program strategy in terms of quality, money, and time. Guides employees and gives them operational guidance, both technically and organizationally. The Associate Principal Scientist will act as Dyson’s technical specialist and subject matter expert in our research programs and be a key driver in the execution of the projects commissioned. Running an area in fast-paced fashion retail, you ensure that the stores (1 Flagship + 8 Store) in your area inspire customers to explore their personal style. You are responsible for setting a strategy in line with country goals to maximize sales and profitability for an area. Together with the Area team, you support and lead the store teams to create the best shopping experiences in fashion retail. Always meeting the expectations of customers and colleagues, as well as following H&M routines and standard. Key responsibilities: Selling You Identify sales opportunities and implement strategies to enhance the shopping experience in the stores in your area, ensuring that sales target and country goals are reached. Ensure that the sales budget is established, achieved and constantly reviewed for opportunities. Follow up and evaluate sales KPIs with the Area team and Store Managers; initiate actions accordingly. Ensure, maintain and increase H&M standards of customer service in your area. Keep up-to-date with customer needs, competitor’s activities and market trends in the retail industry; initiate actions accordingly ensuring that H&M stays at the forefront of the market. Assess, optimize and follow up store’s store operations level, concept performance, as well as stock level aligned to customer’s behaviors and purchase trends in your area. Review and create business proposals on store layouts and visual levels together with the Area team and country management. Ensure that all sales campaign and activities are implemented with high level of commerciality and customer experience. Team You coach and guide Store Managers and the Area Team, driving team performance and Everyone is a Leader Mindset. You support, lead and manage your store and area teams to increase overall team satisfaction as well as results and customer experience in your area. Update the Area team and Store Managers on business performance, area and company goals and any other relevant issues - assess and ensure professional and personal goals of Store Managers and Area team are met. Ensure and execute recruitment process for store management and the Area team. Monitor and evaluate the performance of Store Managers and Area team members; drives performance through development reviews, as well as strong talent pipeline and succession planning.

You are responsible for supporting the brand and hiring managers in strengthening People and Culture, by setting and implementing talent acquisition strategies and initiatives to deliver high performing teams, drive continuous talent growth as well as acquiring right skills and competency – future proofing the business from a talent perspective. You contribute actively to employer branding, both internal and external, bringing to live our Employee Value Proposition and building a true sense of belonging among teams. Key responsibilities:Attract, Recruit and Introduce Initiate, propose and take actions to make H&M an attractive employer, both internally and externally. Analyze future teams’ needs, in terms of skills and competency, establish an action plan  to close gaps through meaningful collaboration with Country HRM as well as respective hiring managers and stakeholders. Implement and uphold a quality recruitment process for all positions, inline with global and local routines as well as labor legislation. Supports the development of people centricity in hiring managers by introducing the talent mindset - influencing managers through recruitment process and frequent conversation about talents. Network and maintain strong connections to talents, talents pools and talent agencies, through frequent chats and is up to date with insights on industry trends. Collaborate, Manage and Develop You are the speaking partner to hiring managers and supports with acquiring right talent for the team as well as mapping future skills and competency needs. The recruitment journey is fully managed and coordinated by you from start to finish ensuring a good candidate experience, positive employer branding as well as ensuring deadlines are met and feedbacks given as appropriate. You support the development of hiring managers in taking a wholistic view of their teams through influencing and catalytic actions – such as regular check ins on performance and development potentials, upskilling needs, disengagement and flight risk, general well being and psychological safety. Provide HR support and consultation to managers through coaching, training and advice that are aligned to H&M Brand’s culture and value as well as EVP.

Nomura Overview Nomura is a Global financial services group with an integrated global network spanning over 30 countries. By connecting markets East & West, Nomura services the needs of individuals, institutions, corporates and governments through its four business divisions: Retail, Asset Management, Wholesale (Global Markets and Investment Banking) and Merchant Banking. Founded in 1925, the firm is built on a tradition of disciplined entrepreneurship, serving clients with creative solutions and considered thought leadership. For further information about Nomura, visit www.nomura.com. Function Overview The Client Onboarding ("COB") team is the central point of contact for both established and new clients account inquiries. When a business opportunity is established, the COB analyst will liaise directly with the client to ensure their account will be set up with complete functionality on the trading and other internal operational platforms. Additionally, COB represents the client's interests to internal counterparts including but not limited to Credit Risk, Operations and Legal. For Sales coverage, COB ensures any client issues are promptly surfaced, escalated, and resolved in a timely manner to ensure uninterrupted service and a quality client experience. This role requires strong relationship management, organizational and communication skills in delivering commercial impact to the onboarding process. In addition, knowledge about the Firm's products and services is essential to ensure efficient and complete onboarding. Internally the COB team is also responsible for establishing and implementing procedures and controls related to account opening as well as identifying opportunities to streamline the process. The team constantly works to enhance current technology for effectively capturing and managing the information and reference data of clients. Job Responsibilities: Responsible for onboarding various clients from different organizational types and locations Liaising with the client, providing support and guidance throughout the documentation completion process to ensure quality and completeness Coordinate with Sales and Business CAO to prioritize account requests and communicate with internal stakeholders Provide onboarding status updates to Sales teams, Business CAO and Client Monitor duration, advise clients and internal stakeholders on emerging issues, actively troubleshoot problems and collaborate across the firm to unblock barriers Work closely with internal stakeholders including Sales Support, Compliance, KYC Controls, Audit & Risk Job Requirements: Minimum of 2 years of work experience in the banking industry Degree in finance or economics is preferred Equity and Fixed Income derivative products knowledge is preferred Knowledge in the industry regulations is preferred e.g. Dodd Frank, EMIR and FATCA Flexibility, adaptable, ability to manage competing demands Resilience to work in a fast-paced and demanding environment Able to multi-task handling urgent and ad hoc requests Time management skills to focus on agreed priorities Detail-oriented, strong awareness on cost and control Confident and strong client service focus when dealing with internal and external clients A control mindset and a solid understanding of regulations and associated risks Understanding and adherence to Compliance and Regulatory influences within the onboarding process Diversity Statement Nomura is committed to an employment policy of equal opportunities, and is fundamentally opposed to any less favourable treatment accorded to existing or potential members of staff on the grounds of race, creed, colour, nationality, disability, marital status, pregnancy, gender or sexual orientation. DISCLAIMER : This Job Description is for reference only, and whilst this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the current job, it is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, skills, efforts, requirements or working conditions associated with the job. The management reserves the right to revise the job and may, at his or her discretion, assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

Nomura Overview Nomura is an Asia-headquartered financial services group with an integrated global network spanning over 30 countries. By connecting markets East & West, Nomura services the needs of individuals, institutions, corporates and governments through its four business divisions: Retail, Asset Management, Wholesale (Global Markets and Investment Banking) and Merchant Banking. Founded in 1925, the firm is built on a tradition of disciplined entrepreneurship, serving clients with creative solutions and considered thought leadership. For further information about Nomura, visit www.nomura.com. Function Overview: Reporting to Head of IWM Compliance - Singapore, with main responsibility for providing compliance support to the International Wealth Management Division (private bank) of Nomura Singapore Limited and Nomura Trust Company Singapore Limited. Responsibilities: Provide daily compliance support, review and advice for Wealth Management and Trust business and service units in Singapore in areas such as cross border queries, Accredited Investor clarifications, suitability requirements, product risk and features disclosures, marketing materials review, handling of material non-public information etc. Partner with Wealth Management and Trust business in growth initiatives, drafting new compliance P&P where required, reviewing new product/services requests. Conduct compliance monitoring and desk reviews as 2nd Line of Defence in areas such as suitability, pricing disclosures, best execution etc. Provide training on new or updated compliance policies and procedures. Analyse changes in regulatory requirements in SG and discuss with business to ensure compliance with the changes. Review and assess regulatory implications for potential breaches of Compliance P&P such as client confidentiality breaches. Review escalations of by Compliance Surveillance teams in relation to internal and external communications. Investigate client complaints together with IWM Business Management team. Support IWM Front Office Supervision in their scope of monitoring and reviews. Coordinate submission of periodic or ad hoc regulatory reports Handle regulatory inquiries, examinations and audits and liaise with regulators, Legal, internal and external auditors. Requirements: Mandatory Degree or equivalent preferably in a relevant discipline (e.g. Finance, Business, Accounting, Legal) Minimum 8 years experience in Compliance in a private bank or wealth management unit of a financial institution. Familiar with PB Code of Conduct and relevant sections in Securities & Futures Act, Financial Advisors Act and Banking Act and their subsidiary legislations and MAS notices and guidelines. Familiar with the operations of wealth management business and the corresponding rules and regulations and able to identify compliance/regulatory risks within the business Experience and knowledge in regulatory analysis of cross border requirements for clients residing in Europe and Middle East would be an advantage. Good analytical and investigation skills and able to work independently Excellent negotiating and inter-personal skills; should be a solutions driven, confident, highly motivated and organized team player with impeccable integrity; should possess excellent issue spotting, analytical and resolution of conflicts skills Ability to act decisively and independently in situations requiring quick analysis Good understanding of relevant Singapore laws and regulations Excellent skill in spoken and written English. Mandarin would be an added advantage. Preferred Understanding of main Asia Pacific laws and regulations, especially Hong Kong Experience in conducting monitoring, surveillance and desk reviews Experience in handling queries from and dealing with regulatory bodies Diversity Statement Nomura is committed to an employment policy of equal opportunities, and is fundamentally opposed to any less favourable treatment accorded to existing or potential members of staff on the grounds of race, creed, colour, nationality, disability, marital status, pregnancy, gender or sexual orientation. Raffles Hotel Singapore welcomed guests in August 2019 after a careful and sensitive restoration breathing new life into its beautiful building. One of the few remaining great 19th century hotels in the world, the hotel is perfectly preserved both inside and out, giving it an intoxicating blend of luxury, history and classic colonial design. Its distinctive architecture, legendary heritage and iconic service continue to enthrall visitors where restored suites, new social spaces, restaurants and bars have been enhanced for discerning travellers. No visit to Singapore is complete without a stay here, where the grand historic hotel exudes old-world grandeur infused with the unique charm of the city state. Guests can experience the modern comfort and amenities presented within 115 luxuriously spacious suites complemented by our legendary 24-hour Raffles Butler Service and a heritage tour of the property by our Resident Historian. 10 restaurants and bars present both local favourites, fine dining and collaborations with internationally renowned chefs and curated classics such as the iconic Singapore Sling experience and classic Raffles Afternoon Tea amidst the colonial charm of the historic Grand Lobby. A rooftop swimming pool and state-of-the-art fitness centre provide a respite from the hustle and bustle of the city while the new Raffles Spa is a holistic sanctuary offering pampering spa experiences and renewed well-being. Guests are also invited to visit the Raffles Boutique to shop for gourmet gifts and heritage-inspired souvenirs and a revitalized Raffles Arcade showcasing an elegant mix of new-to-market, and world-renowned international brands, collectively creating a one-of-a-kind retail experience that goes beyond traditional brick and mortar shopping. Official website URL: www.rafflessingapore.com Job Purpose The position is responsible for maintaining the cleanliness and quality of all F&B and kitchen equipment and areas so that all guests will enjoy a safe and wonderful dining experience and kitchen hygiene standards are met, through active supervision of the Steward Attendant and with the commitment to complete the job well.

Job_Title: Senior Regional Business Development Manager - SG based
Job_Descriptions: Regional Senior Business Development Manager (SG Based) We are building out a world class business development team here at aCommerce and require people who excel in fast paced, performance driven, customer facing environments. We are the leading ecommerce enabler in ASEAN and are in an exciting growth period at which you will be working with the key decision makers of global brands on a daily basis, ensuring that we exceed their expectations as well as establish long term relationships. As the Regional Senior Business Development Manager, you will be responsible to educate clients about our company's services in order to develop strong relationships with some of biggest brands in the region. The role will be focused on generating new business opportunities to achieve our sales plan. The role requires a strong understanding of the sales process, excelling at prospecting, starting new relationships, and setting up our sales teams for success. You will work directly with our Group Business Development Head to strategize, propose, and close new business. This is a great opportunity for proven sales driven individual looking to be a part of a leading company within the fast-growing Ecommerce industry. The role will be based in Singapore or Thailand and we offer a competitive base salary with incentives for achieving goals. Responsibilities • Represent our company’s solutions and services with comprehensive understanding to identify the needs of our prospects • Researching organizations and individuals to find new opportunities through various lead generation tools and database • Engaging prospects for meetings to demonstrate our solutions and services • Prepare and coordinate proposals or contracts aligned with company business guidelines • Work closely with regional marketing team to generate leads • Coordinating with local sales team on engaging regional opportunities to achieve new business key metrics and goals • Manage opportunities within CRM to monitor sales cycles and overall sales performance • Identify best practices to refine the company’s Sales Development playbook • Attend seminars, conferences and events where appropriate Qualification 4+ years prior experience in a Business Development role with proven performance from either SaaS, Retail, Distribution, Consulting, and Ecommerce solutions companies Experience managing senior stakeholders and excellent communication skills Knowledge of CRM to manage the sales process Experience with databases, segmentation, and necessary lead generation tools Strong communication skills-both verbally and in writing. Fluent in English Goal oriented and self-motivated with ability to work independently, but within a team in a fast-paced and KPI driven environment Demonstrated initiative and desire to learn about new products, solutions, and industries • Strong desire and ability to move up within a fast-growing organization

Job_Title: Senior Software Engineer- Agent Workspace Platform
Job_Descriptions: Job Description Zendesk is looking for a Senior Software Engineer who is motivated and driven to make an impact for the future of customer support. You will be working on challenging problems of establishing a platform that provides crucial integration to enable an omnichannel experience. This position will be based out of our Asian HQ in Singapore, partnered with dedicated engineers from the team, and working on the building blocks to make outstanding customer support possible. Our team focuses on the backend side to provide needed pieces so that different product offerings from Zendesk can be brought together into a unified experience. Starting with Support, Chat and Messaging, we are delivering a next generation integrated product that allows our customers to seamlessly use either channel, as well as Voice, in order to provide scalable customer support. You’ll be part of this journey, working with teams in San Francisco, Melbourne, Montreal, Dublin as well as other teams in Singapore, to take on responsibility and provide the needed components and services so the products can operate on top of it. This will be an exciting engineering opportunity as we integrate our respective systems to the next level - it will be engineering at scale, in terms of traffic, data size and growth, revenue impact, visibility, and strategic significance to the entire business’s future. What you get to do every day: Design, code and deliver scalable and reliable backend systems that support our omnichannel integration strategy. Ensure scalability, performance, maintainability and security of the technical platform in collaboration with ops teams. Enhancing applications by finding opportunities for improvement, making recommendations and designing and implementing systems Identify, track and monitor key metrics to ensure stability and reliability of our systems. Identify areas of our product and infrastructure that need improvement and drive fixes to completion. Participate in all phases of the software lifecycle. Mentor and guide junior team members by reviewing their code submissions, code pairing, and being a sounding board. Become a key contributor to better working practices across Zendesk. What you bring to the role: Previous experience in software engineering making active technical contributions involving web infrastructure or distributed systems. Advanced knowledge with a server-side technology, one of Java, Ruby/Rails or Python/Django Working knowledge with one or more of the following data stores and systems: MySQL (or other relational DBs), Kafka, Redis Solid understanding of architecture of highly concurrent and low latency systems and common tradeoffs with regard to performance, scalability and reliability Passion for understanding complex systems, debugging problems, and pushing solutions to production. Outstanding all-round communication skills and ability to work collaboratively Previous exposure to Kafka Streams or Kubernetes is a plus Culture and Perks We have 150+ staff in our Singapore office which is home to our highly successful chat product. We approach work with calm, focus, a sense of humour whilst keeping sane working hours. You will work with supportive peers that truly care about our customers and deliver value for them. At Zendesk we also have a culture where ideas come from the bottom up. Perks include stock, flexible working, $1500 training allowance, medical insurance coverage for you and your family, mobile phone allowance, home internet reimbursement, wfh equipment budget, and 4 months parental leave. #LI-SKD About Zendesk - Champions of Customer Service Zendesk started the customer experience revolution in 2007 by enabling any business around the world to take their customer service online. Today, Zendesk is the champion of great service everywhere for everyone, and powers billions of conversations, connecting more than 100,000 logos with hundreds of millions of customers over telephony, chat, email, messaging, social channels, communities, review sites and help centers. Zendesk products are built with love to be loved. The company was conceived in Copenhagen, Denmark, built and grown in California, taken public in New York City, and today employs more than 4,000 people across the world. Learn more at www.zendesk.com. We believe in service. Learn more about how we provide support to our local communities with volunteering, grants and product donations. Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here. U.S. Applicants Only: Consistent with Zendesk’s emphasis on employee wellness and our shared interest in public health, Zendesk requires all U.S. employees to provide proof of full vaccination against COVID-19.  Zendesk will consider accommodations for reasons recognized by applicable law. Zendesk prohibits discrimination and will not tolerate discrimination based on a person’s disability, physical or mental conditions, religion, or any other status protected by law. Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to ********@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request. Job_Title: Trade Promotion Analytics - Global Business Analyst
Job_Descriptions: Trade Promotion Analytics - Global Business Analyst Job ID: R-31050 Category: Data & Analytics Location: Singapore Date posted: 02/18/2022 JOB TITLE: Trade Promotion Analytics - Global Business AnalystJOB LOCATION: SingaporeRELOCATION TERMS: Local terms BACKGROUND/BUSINESS CONTEXT For Unilever to remain competitive in the future, the business needs to continue its path to become data intelligent. The Data and Analytics team is responsible for building data, data science and analytics as a core capability to help the business become data intelligent and drive business and organization performance.  The team will deliver advanced products at scale and work closely with the market teams to ensure that decisions in Unilever are augmented with insight & recommendations wherever possible. There are five major themes to the Data and Analytics strategy: Deliver Intelligent systems at scale . Powering Business (cross functional) and Customer Development area through data and analytics. Building out the right applications to enable business teams to move faster, with more accurate and future looking decisions leveraging Big Data & Data Science Winning disproportionately in Market . We believe that the best way to move the needle for Unilever in Analytics is to work with leading geographies to create analytics products that make a significant impact on our business Drive Unilever to assisted and predictive decision-making . The future is about assisted decision-making with machines (AI/Cognitive Computing/Machine Learning) unlocking the insights from vast deluge of consumer, customer & internal data, and presenting this in a way that is simple for our teams. Make data a true asset . Better data and data science access for every part of Unilever, across the 3 data framework (Connectivity, Growth, Continuous Improvement) and leading through the Enterprise Data Executive. World-class Data : One Version of the Facts. Continued excellence in delivery of diagnostics and insights to focus attention when and where it matters with a focus on Big B UniOps, Strategic Initiatives and Leadership team reporting This is an exciting new role in the Data & Analytics, which is tasked to deliver maximum value from data to drive business and organization performance. The UNIOPS D&A CD Analytics Product group helps the global Unilever CD business win with data, data science, and analytics in a way that leverages the close engagement/ relationship with CD leadership supported by a data science hub team so that they can solve for both large transformation programs and near-term business problems. The UNIOPS D&A CD Analytics Product group is composed of product managers, analytics managers and product activation managers who can: quickly understand the business context + problem, apply advanced mathematics and/or statistics to large data sets; and operate in cloud-based environments where data, models, and user interfaces reside in the same platforms-core technologies. MAIN PURPOSE OF THE JOB Expected Work This role will focus on the development and deployment of algorithmic powered solution, Trade Promotion Analytics (TPA) to help the business make more effective decisions in the in the areas of Net Revenue Management (NRM) and Promotion planning. The role will be expected to blend the expertise of Business Consultancy, Data Analysis and Business Intelligence to design, and develop analytics solutions. These prototypes if successful will be expected to scaled where the BA will be expected to partner technical teams and cover the key aspects of data required to deliver information and analytics capabilities for Customer Development teams. To be successful, the candidate should thrive working with both technical teams and commercial business teams.  Ensuring a healthy balance between global scale and local relevancy of the solutions is also the key expectation to this role. The position will be both an individual contributor and manager role expected to manage several Unilever FTEs, and possibly third-party contractors or external analytics partners. The role has three main accountabilities: Co-leads engagement, requirements gathering, translate business requirements into analytics requirements and developing working prototypes of analytics solutions that can be added as a module or evolve certain module of the core TPA product. Governs the design of global TPA user-journey Golden Template. Works with stakeholders to identify priorities and critical data sources to meet business requirements. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Owns the TPA user-journey golden template and local customization (includes KPIs calculations) prototypes. This includes the translations of business requirements into technical requirements for technical partners appointed. Support the delivery of the agreed capabilities, working with virtual/physical teams. To understand and apply D&A analytics framework, delivery model and best practice guidelines. Leading meetings to present design proposal and recommendations to business partners and internal team members Support transition to “business as usual” incl. embedding solution in business process & value tracking via evolving training materials to support change management. Serve as the trusted data and analytics consultant for key project stakeholders Own the market engagement, requirement gathering and translation into analytics requirements. Work seamless with other teams e.g., Data Science, Data Expertise and Product Owners/Managers. Accountable for innovating at least 1-2 new data and analytic methodologies. KEY REQUIREMENTS: Have Undergraduate or Masters Degree level qualifications. Preferred (but not a requirement) disciplines include; Operations Research, Economics/Mathematics, Business Studies/MBA, Engineering, Computer Science. Overall experience of 3+ years preferred Strong track record of working with business users to drive definition, alignment, and support for application of analytics and data to address complex business issues (e.g. centralization of promotion spending decisions) Passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data Ability to rapidly connect + match analytics and data products to business needs Expert knowledge of an analysis tool such as Microsoft PowerBI, and Tableau Working knowledge of an analysis tool such as R, Python, or PySpark. Working knowledge to apply Microsoft Azure analytics product to develop scaled analytic models in the cloud Ability to apply an agile analytic approach that allows for results at varying levels of precision Ability to communicate complex quantitative insights in a precise, and actionable manner TO APPLY Please apply online by clicking on “Apply” below. Your application will be reviewed against our requirements. Should you not meet our immediate requirements, your profile will be registered in our talent pool system and we will match your profile to suitable future vacancies. You will be able to access your status update through the candidate tracking link. Thank you for your interest and application. Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‘Whole Self’ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.

You are part of a team that develops and enhances the Strategic Communications (SC) capabilities of the Town Council. On this, you will assist the Corporate Communications Manager in the identification of operational concepts and desired capabilities for Strategic Communications, as well as to work out a master plan to develop these capabilities and manage related projects. You will also establish response plans to anticipated scenarios with significant SC impact. Your challenge lies in identifying and incorporating new initiatives to ensure that the Town Council stays at the leading edge of the information curve. Your other duties include: Assist in drafting communications materials (e.g. writing press releases, synopsis, publicity contents) Assist in poster designs Compile, track, summarise and report on media coverage Conduct background research on topics Assist with maintaining contact lists, editorial forward features lists, and event calendars Assist with corporate communications and media relations engagements (e.g. liaising with journalists, distributing press releases, providing support for press conferences) Assist on new business initiatives (e.g. conducting research on prospects, creating and editing PowerPoint presentations and proposals, etc.) Other tasks as necessary Requirements: · Tertiary qualification, preferably in social sciences or mass communication, with electives in organisation and/or business development; · Good verbal, writing and analytical skills; · Capable of handling multiple projects independently; · Enjoy working on a varied portfolio; · Interest in and good knowledge of social media platforms and new developments in communication is necessary; - Has a creative eye; and · Has a positive working attitude.

Job_Title: Information Technology and Digitalization Officer / Executive
Job_Descriptions: He/ She shall be tasked to carry out the following duties: Operation Provide IT Support to all the office within the organisation. Provide efficient and effective day-to-day IT support to operation. Administer and maintain servers, computers, network and communication channels (email and telephony system) Install and configure IT operating systems and applications Perform backups, apply operating system updates, patches Liaise with various IT vendors and System Providers to perform troubleshooting, rectification backup and/or assistance in patching/upgrading of all system installed in our office. Ensure that all IT helpdesk request are handled professionally and executed in a timely manner. Source for products, evaluate and propose new office hardware and software. IT Asset management including hardware and software license management Render support for IT recovery, IT audit and project implementation Perform any other IT related tasks assigned as required by the management Data Science Access to organisation information through various systems and create ways of reporting on data. Review and compare sets of data to gain insight and suggest control/enhancement which are practical for the organisation to implement and track. Apply statistical and data mining techniques to identify emerging trends, anomalies and opportunities, to derive assessments and drive toward insight improving growth, experience and key operational decisions Explore and implement analytical solutions using existing data infrastructure Manage monthly and ad hoc reporting to respective data owners. Present analytical insights to management via ad-hoc reports Maintain and improve existing data gathering process to enable prompt turnaround for ad hoc review. Requirements: Degree or Diploma in relevant disciple, Data Science / Analytical field preferred. Relevant work experience would be a plus point. Knowledge of common analytical tool. (Power BI, Python, Excel, etc) Skills required to handle software development and cloud-based technologies Effective analytic/diagnostic skills Strong analytical, communication and presentation skills Innovative mindset and able to challenge assumptions Good knowledge of new/latest technologies and technological trends, and able to gauge suitability to the TC’s needs Performance driven, capable of working independently or with a team and have high level of initiative and integrity

If you love to play the leading role in driving IT innovations for the Wildlife Industry, we invite you to join us at Mastermark Pte Ltd for a ‘wildly’ exciting IT career! You will be at the forefront of Singapore’s bird and wildlife management, striving to provide a resolution to wildlife and human conflicts. We are driven by the excitement of building new technologies, inventing products, providing consulting advice and services that turn nature conflicts into long-term business opportunities. We have worked with hundreds of organizations, both government and private sectors, and we are seeking an enterprising IT professional to join our team and fill this role! Your Role: This position suits an IT professional who wishes to make his/her mark in driving IT innovations for Wildlife and raising the company’s IT initiatives. Specifically, you will: • Work with external stakeholders (software developers and learning institutes) to create a new app for our Wildlife application (including frontend and backend systems) • Oversee the design requirements and other technical aspects of the app development process. • Set up the maintenance protocols and undertake post launch system enhancement based on client needs. • Provide IT support to other projects, gadgets and innovations based on user requirements and work processes. • Manage the company’s server database and other internal IT requirements. • Lead the company’s IT initiative and propose IT innovations to management and clients. Our Requirements: • Degree in Computer Science, or a field related to Information Technology. • 2-5 years of experience involving some aspects of mobile app development and system design/management. • Experience with native C/C++ for backend and React for frontend development. • Basic understanding of Synology NAS or similar file management solutions. • Experience with Python, particularly for use in Raspberry Pi/Arduino, would be an advantage. • Able to initiate and manage IT processes to increase company effectiveness and efficiency. • Able to work independently and keep abreast of industry technical developments. About Schlumberger: We are Schlumberger, the leading provider of technology and services to the energy industry. Throughout much of the oil and gas lifecycle in over 120 countries; we design, develop and deliver technology and services that transforms how work is done. We define the boundaries of the industry by unleashing our talented people's energy. We are looking for innovators to join our diverse community of colleagues and develop new solutions and push the limits of what is possible. If you share our passion for discovery and want to find out what you could really do, then here is the place to do it. Electrical Engineer (Product Development/ Microwave Electronics) Location: Benoi Company Transport Provided (Boon Lay) Salary Up to $5500 depending on experience AWS + VB Responsibilities: Analyze, design, develop, and maintain products; assist in commercialization. Define design specifications based on project requirements. Select electrical components to meet design specifications. Develop and implement circuits, test and troubleshoot designs. Build prototypes, products, and systems for testing; set up and run laboratory tests. Create design and product documentation. Design testing procedures and coordinate testing. Conduct tests, document results, and develop client presentation. Conduct and/or participate in technical reviews of requirements, specifications, designs, codes, and other artifacts. Evaluate engineering approaches and risks to produce and iterate development plans. Identify and keep abreast of novel technical concepts and markets. Contribute to design standards and support design reuse. Author technical reports, papers, articles, presentations, and patents. Qualifications Master's, or bachelor's degree in electrical or electronic engineering Knowledge and experience in designing electronics hardware such as sensors, communication modules and power supply modules Knowledge and experience in microwave electronics or firmware development will be a bonus If you possess relevant skillsets, do apply with an updated CV in word format. We shall contact shortlisted candidates. Always Active These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms.    You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information. These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites.    They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising. These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages.    If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly. About Schlumberger: We are Schlumberger, the leading provider of technology and services to the energy industry. Throughout much of the oil and gas lifecycle in over 120 countries; we design, develop and deliver technology and services that transforms how work is done. We define the boundaries of the industry by unleashing our talented people's energy. We are looking for innovators to join our diverse community of colleagues and develop new solutions and push the limits of what is possible. If you share our passion for discovery and want to find out what you could really do, then here is the place to do it. Manufacturing Engineer (Electrical/Process/RF Technology) Location: Benoi Company Transport Provided (Boon Lay) Salary Up to $5500 depending on experience AWS + VB Responsibilities: Responsible for the implementation of key elements of Lean, such as: standardized work instructions, line balancing, layout and work sequence (routing) optimization, training development matrix, Value Stream Mapping, Kaizen/5S workouts, pull processes, TPM (total preventive maintenance), cell design, and quick changeover/batch-size optimization. Processes Implement process improvements to achieve manufacturing excellence in areas such as process yield (e.g. First Pass Yield, Rolled Throughput Yield), cycle time reduction and productivity. Provide shop floor feedback on product design and manufacturability issues to Engineering and DFMs (e.g. through the use of Engineering Change Requests - ECRs) Review and sign-off on Engineering Change Orders that impact Inventory - including product life cycle issues, obsolescence, etc. Creates, implements, and monitors key performance indicators and metrics on manufacturing process capability and product quality. Monitoring and reducing process costs. Quality Responsible to assist with investigation, root cause analysis and corrective action implementation for manufacturing quality issues. Electrical Competency Experience with electrical/electronic equipment such as Continuity Tester, Power supplies, Soldering systems and Signal Generators. Experience in reviewing interface drawings and electronic circuit schematics. Experience in RF Technology will be ideal such as troubleshooting antennas, hands on experience using Network Analyzers & Spectrum Analyzers. Requirements: Bachelor's/Master's in Electrical engineering 1-2 years' experience with interest in Manufacturing Knowledge of LEAN Six Sigma techniques and metrics Knowledge of mechanical and electrical manufacturing processes, including assembly and testing Knowledge of equipment and tools If you possess relevant skillsets, do apply with an updated CV in word format. Job_Descriptions: Job Description CREATE ‘WILD’ SOLUTIONS for WILDLIFE! We are looking for a creative mind to engineer solutions for our varied Wildlife projects. We invite you to join us at Mastermark Pte Ltd for a ‘wildly’ exciting engineering career! You will be at the forefront of Singapore’s bird and wildlife management, striving to provide a resolution to wildlife and human conflicts. We are driven by the excitement of building new technologies, inventing products, providing consulting advice and services that turn nature conflicts into long-term business opportunities. We have worked with hundreds of organisations, both government and private sectors, and we are seeking an enterprising Engineer to join our team and fill this role! Your Role: This position plays an important role in supporting our varied wildlife projects which require engineering expertise. Specifically, you will: • Be part of a team exploring and developing several wildlife trapping/ deterrent/ proofing systems and remote monitoring devices. • Innovate and improve existing wildlife traps/ deterrent/ proofing systems and remote monitoring devices. • Integrate multiple existing systems into a singular product and solve problems related to these systems. • Manage engineering projects from start to end, including design, material selection, conception, prototyping and trials of these systems. Our Requirements: • Degree in Engineering, preferably Mechanical Engineering. • 2-5 years of working experience in design/ development/ R&D. • Able to work with the team and external stakeholders on multiple projects concurrently. • Able to clearly explain engineering and design choices of the product to management and clients. • Able to work independently and keep abreast of industry technical developments • Familiarity with Raspberry Pi or Arduino would be a bonus. • Experience with implementing electrical components (e.g. rechargeable batteries) into a system would be an advantage. • Enjoy the challenge of providing ‘Wild’ engineering solutions to our varied real-life problems out in the ‘Wild’. Job_Title: East Asia Business Development Manager of Global Payment
Job_Descriptions: Our Client: Our client is a MNC in internet technology. They're actively looking to hire a Business Development Manager to handle the global payment in Singapore. The Responsibilities: * Analyze and understand local payment market development history and trends, follow payment regulation, policy changes and guidelines * Connect with top players in the payment segment, do comparison across partners and solutions and identify the fit synergies across business segments and payment solutions * Work closely with the territory teams to understand local needs and proactively work on solutions to support business growth * Establish connections with key stakeholders, including but not limited to payment partners, regulators, and top players in different business segments * Ensuring excellent communication and internal coordination to roll-out new services, taking into account market specificity (regulation, competition, etc.) * Managing existing accounts to maximize revenue through cross and up selling opportunities and maximizing customer satisfaction The Requirements: * At least 3+ years of business development/sales experience with in depth cross border payments industry * Have a good understanding of the digital payment industry development of East Asia regional and well connected to Banks and Cross Border Payment Providers * Excellent communication skills, fluent in written and spoken English and also in Japanese or Korean is required due to the nature of the work to be able to liaise effectively with native Japanese -or Korean-speaking stakeholders * Strong balance of both strategic planning and active hands-on approach * This will be a hands-on role with deep involvement in execution, leading from the front * Possess a can-do attitude, entrepreneurial drive, focusing on solving problems creatively with a high level of energy Disclaimer: The Company complies with the Tripartite Guidelines on Fair Employment Practices (TGFEP), including the prevailing guidelines on recruitment. Job_Title: Asia Product Development Lead Specialist – TTS - Senior Vice President
Job_Descriptions: The Asia Trade Product Development team is a horizontal organization cutting across all Trade products and solutions with a primary objective of digitizing our capabilities front to back and to enhance client experience, considering the evolution of the industry and clients’ needs. Working closely with our partners across TTS Products, Operations and Technology and the Product Management team, this team will lead the client experience and trade digital agenda, the modernization and build-out of our infrastructure, development of a holistic data strategy and commercialization of our new digital solutions in Asia The Asia Trade Product Development Lead Specialist role would encompass leading product design ideas, product and application developments as well as partnerships and alliances to accelerate the innovation. It would be instrumental in driving the short to medium terms digital product strategy within Trade to future proof the business from the rapid change and disruptions in the marketplace. The Asia Trade Product Development Lead Specialist will have continued engagement with client facing trade teams (Sales, Client Management team) for identification of new opportunities including those where we will co-create with clients. Direct client engagement will be needed for origination, validation and execution of ideas The role will have significant interaction with senior management and stakeholders across Trade in region and outside and will work with various partner groups including Country Product, Innovation Labs, Operations, Technology, Channels, and Implementations etc. This position reports to the Asia Head of Trade Product Development. Key Responsibilities: Lead product development within the Product Innovation and Tech space via a combination of Project & Product management skill set; This would entail product design, co-development both internally as well with external service providers (Fintech/Digital solution developers), as well alliances and partnerships with other bank/tech, entities etc. Provide leadership on development of emerging Trade Digital infrastructure including emerging tech like DLT (distributed ledgers), AI, IoT (Internet of things), Workflow solutions and new pathways for rapid API development and deployment that will fit into the open banking world. This will include building a client friendly narrative that will help scale these initiatives across broader set of clients, geographies, Industries or Products. Lead and drive the Trade specific Data Strategy including development of Data Platform and analytics capabilities. This will entail use of AI and machine learning for prediction/forecasting, recommendation and commercialisation with a view to develop and deploy high value use cases that have potential for becoming powerful client solutions and/or create value for internal processes. Drive adoption of existing proprietary & other new multi-banking Trade Client Communication Channels like: Citi Direct, SWIFT MT798, APIs, DocuSign etc) including development and governance of an optimum operating framework for associated Client and Supplier (For Supplier Finance) on boarding onto these Channels & engagement post on boarding Oversee supplier on-boarding for large multi-country regional supplier finance programs using tools like TAOS/DocuSign To lead the management of the technology book of work for Asia trade by working closely with country product, operations and technology and focusing on proper budgeting, prioritization, project planning and delivery and tracking the tangible outcomes Regular and continued engagements with all the client facing teams for identification of emerging needs and client pain points. Direct client interactions for project deep dives and co-creation opportunities. Focus on producing cutting edge client material and collateral for positioning Citi as thought leader t o clients and represent Citi on relevant industry forums where such discussions are taking place and to introduce new initiatives that will ensure constant flow of ideas to and fro between clients and Citi. Work with fintech, vendors, regulators and other industry partners to bring the outside in and forge partnerships with these stakeholders for opportunity areas with significant and rapid impact; Push through digital skill set development of Trade & Client facing teams through product training modules, short engagements in various work streams with a view to empowering teams to benefit from Collaborate with other TTS businesses (including P&R, Channels, Account Services) with a view to leverage solutions already developed as well as develop internal partnerships for further scaling trade A close look at the market developments and trade technology innovations within the client segments as well as competition – to continue stay ahead of the curve in an ever changing global trade landscape; Setup appropriate & ambitious improvement targets and KPIs for the organization and track progress in delivery Focuses on controls and governance, including performing Need-to-Know based security and access reviews, Access Approvals, controls testing and documentation Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Qualifications: 10+ years of experience Proven track record of successfully managing in a large and complex business Intellectual curiosity, analytical and conceptual thinker Proactively seeks and develops new opportunities Thorough financial acumen and P&L management experience Excellent analytical, interpretive and problem solving skills Proven track record of bringing diverse groups and perspectives to work against a common goal Ability to maintain momentum and minimize client and employee attrition Ability to establish and maintain senior client relationships and to work across multiple facets of Citi businesses Process Management knowledge with a propensity for detail and comprehensiveness of content Ability to collaborate and clearly communicate with senior members of an organization Project Management skills with experience leading large cross functional initiatives Proven track record as change agent, with ability to encourage and embrace innovative ideas and solutions High emphasis on “getting to yes” and building intercompany relationships Self-aware with ability to adapt to various situations, rapidly assimilate and report on complex information while creating a future vision Education: Bachelor’s/University degree, Master’s degree preferred Competencies: - Ability to work within and drive broad group of stakeholders, countries, global and regional teams - Practical knowledge and experience in mapping out client journey and translating into a set customer experience - Comfortable in presenting strategic objectives to senior management, gaining support for key initiatives and then providing regular updates on the progress - Ability to coordinate effectively in a multicultural and multiregional environment - Can work independently (self-starter) and lead a group of resources from various teams - Ability to achieve results through collaboration and networking Development Value: Develop extensive knowledge about Trade business Ability to help shape and execute Global Trade strategy and initiatives Broaden network at Citi and TTS through close interaction with the Trade Senior Management and partners across ICG Be part of an exciting journey as we look to transform the trade business and participate in the exponential growtAch expected in the payables business. ------------------------------------------------- Job Family Group: Product Management and Development ------------------------------------------------- Job Family: Product Development ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Job_Descriptions: The Investment Associate is a developing professional role. Deals with most problems independently and has some latitude to solve complex problems. Integrates in-depth specialty area knowledge with a solid understanding of industry standards and practices. Good understanding of how the team and area integrate with others in accomplishing the objectives of the sub function/ job family. Applies analytical thinking and knowledge of data analysis tools and methodologies. Job Description You will assist in post-trade compliance, assist in the monitoring of the investment and transactional activities of fund managers to ensure compliance with regulatory and client-mandated investment guidelines.  You will also ensure that all client reporting are done accurately and on a timely basis. As our fund managers invest in a broad range of instruments, you should have some knowledge in various financial securities products. Responsibilities Review and maintenance of accurate compliance rules across all fund types, in accordance with Investment guidelines or compliance parameters provided by client / fund manager. Ensure accurate and correct interpretation of guidelines and the creation of relevant rules in the compliance monitoring system. Ensure that alerts and / or breaches are monitored daily and follow-up action taken and documented. Updating of Operating Procedures Manual and Operating Memorandums with clients. By adhering to guidelines and checklists, ensure that standard procedures and controls, as set out in the Operating Procedures Manual, are being adhered to. Responsible for ensuring that all the daily / non-daily reporting to clients are met as per requirements. Attend to client queries. Assist Funds Compliance Monitoring Manager in the smooth running of the compliance monitoring function of the department, including adherence to corporate and regulatory policies and requirements. Assist in process improvement initiatives. Assist in training and development of new or inexperienced staff. Assist in user acceptance testing. Working with internal/external parties (for example clients, fund managers, vendors, fund accountants, auditors etc) Qualifications/Requirements Degree in Banking / Finance or Accountancy 4 - 6 years experience in the financial industry (fund management / insurance business will be preferred) with relevant experience in post-trade compliance platforms, creating and maintaining rules for purposes of portfolio compliance. Knowledge of the various component feeds to the system (fund accounting data base, third party vendor feeds) will be an added advantage. Strong working knowledge of investment guidelines, securities ratings and industry classification, benchmark indexes, etc. Demonstrating a high level of accuracy and attention to detail. Ability to write macros and rule logic, knowledge of SQL and data mapping will be a plus. Computer literate with good working knowledge of Excel & macros. Preferably with working knowledge of SQL and data mapping. Able to interpret legal clauses and paraphrase into simple and clear requirements. Service-oriented and client focused. A team player with strong oral, written and interpersonal communication skills. Willing to work on Singapore public holidays. ------------------------------------------------- Job Family Group: Operations - Transaction Services ------------------------------------------------- Job Family: Fund Accounting ------------------------------------------------------ Time Type: Full time ------------------------------------------------------ Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Job Title Technical Support Manager, EDI Job Description The Role: The Enterprise Diagnostic Informatics Technical Support Manager (TSM) is responsible for the daily management of the install base lifecycle processes covering all aspects of customer engagement in the delivery of quality informatics support services. The role serves as a single point of contact to ensure systems are healthy, up and running, providing regular updates on solution performance. Tracking outstanding support issues and engaging with customer support, as a customer advocate, to drive resolution/ensure speedy closure of customer issues or engaging with product management/3rd parties to prioritize defect resolution and system/product enhancements. The role is accountable to build and maintain trusting post sale relationships with assigned customer accounts. It’s customer facing role and engages with healthcare organizations whereby Philips’s solution is in use. Conducting regular technical health checks, documenting, and updating unique site requirements and configurations, reviewing change requests for completeness and compliance with support and customer requirements. Monitoring compute and storage consumption and utilization while advising customers on how to maximize the use of existing solution to optimize technical environment. Proactively identifying and mitigating the impacts of reconfigurations, upgrades or replacements of other customer systems  & also supports the business in the interaction with the install base by maintaining high levels of customer satisfaction while ensuring customers entitlements are delivered with quality. The TSM supports the EDI Operations Manager and Services team to ensure contract penetration and customers realize the full benefits of product features and innovations and these are consumed by customers. In this role, you would be responsible for Serve as the internal advocate for the customer, helping to drive support in order, for the customer to achieve their business objectives. Assist customers in solving point-in-time technical and application challenges Act as a direct point of contact for the customer and account team to drive resolution of product and support issues and communicate within the organization to meet the customer’s needs. Deep understanding & maintain documentation of assigned customer’s environment and leverage this information to ensure overall system health & optimum performance Use technical acumen, solution expertise and customer-facing skills to effectively represent Philips within a customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior leadership regarding incidents, trade-offs and risk management Provide advocacy and tactical technical advice to help plan, maintain, expand and upgrade solutions using standard methodologies, and enthusiastically keep your customers’ Philips environments operationally healthy Manage the contract lifecycle from cost estimation and projected profitability through to offer, acceptance and renewal Managing communications of the customer experience with identified stakeholders to ensure awareness. To be successful in this role you need to have Tertiary level education in Information Technology, Software Engineering, Business Management or similar. Minimum of 3 years of experience in deploying and / or supporting medical technologies in clinical workplaces Experience in dynamic teams in diverse large organizations. Experience in team management an added advantage. Experience in change management as it relates to culture and mindset of a complex organization including capabilities building, process design, ownership, and implementation. Ability to build and nurture strong relationships within matrix by developing strong cooperation with peers, cross business, and cross function. Can speak and engage with customer technical teams; Confirms and clarifies information gained from listening to customers before transmitting / sharing. Technical understanding to deliver the responsibilities and tasks. This relates to the application of the required breadth and depth of technical knowledge. This also includes staying abreast of industry developments. Experience in handling and managing support for application. ITIL V3/V4 Foundations certification is an advantage but not mandatory. Customer focus and good problem-solving skills. In return, we offer you A challenging role, working for an employer whose activities have a major positive impact on people's lives all over the world. Sharpen your talents with new challenges in our growing organization, developing new technologies. We are happy to provide you with this opportunity to develop your career. Join our team as we offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits, and flexibility in a career with a positive and supportive atmosphere in which to build your talents further. Why should you join Philips? Working at Philips is more than a job. It is a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video. To find out more about what it is like working for Philips at a personal level; visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions. As an equal opportunity employer, Philips is committed to a diverse workforce

Job_Title: APAC PD-Ultrasound GI Business Marketing Manager
Job_Descriptions: Job Title APAC PD-Ultrasound GI Business Marketing Manager Job Description Philips is a global leader in health technology, committed to improving billions of lives worldwide and striving to make the world healthier and more sustainable through innovation. Driven by the vision of a better tomorrow. But it’s not just what we do, it’s who we are. We are 80,000, wonderfully unique individuals, with two things in common. An unwavering sense of purpose and a relentless determination to deliver on our customers’ needs. It’s what inspires us to create meaningful solutions – the kind that make a real difference – when it matters most. The world and our customers’ needs are changing faster than ever before and while we are proud of what we do already, we know we can do more. That’s why we need you, to help us tackle increasingly complex challenges posed by ever evolving health and well-being needs. In this role, you have the opportunity to make life better Looking at the challenges the world is facing today Philips’ purpose has never been more relevant. So whatever your role, if you share our passion for helping others, you’ll be working towards creating a better and fairer future for all. Senior Managers responsible for translating global clinical (Point of Care, Value and Obstetrics & Gynecology) product portfolio’s in locally relevant value propositions. Regional “BMMs” own the P&L in the matrix from an ultrasound BIU point of view. Specifically, controlling pricing (in collaboration with commercial policy organization), iCOS development (in collaboration with BG counterparts), mCOS productivity (in collaboration with Operations), business specific SELLEX (marketing, commissions, salaries & wages,) in collaboration with the district BM’s and working capital (inventory, demo stock etc.) BMMs work on mid-long term planning (BMC) and spend most of their time ensuring the execution of the agreed upon plans following the 4Ps (Pricing, Promotion, Place, Product) They make sure that plans are executed in time, adequately resource campaigns & problem-solve issues in a timely matter. Together with market intelligence, they keep track of changes in competition and customer segments to change course if needed. BMMs develop, together with district BMs, the appropriate dashboards (leads, opportunities, win-loss) to drive performance. They should specifically not be involved with operational issues (order management, short-term quality issues, short term sales). Countries visits should be focused on driving the growth and fine-tuning assumptions on strategy vs attending client calls, sales meetings or customer events Key Responsibilities Overall responsible for delivering P&L results of specific business (PoC, Value and OBGYN) Translates global portfolio’s in locally relevant value propositions (& solutions) Ensures execution of BMC plans Monitors competitive trends and customer segmentation to adapt strategy whenever needed Handshakes mid-term plans (SPOR / AOP) with global BGs Seen as inspirational and expert on customer segments (vs purely technical view) Develops (in collaboration with Clinical BMM) appropriate training for country roles Develops (in collaboration with sales excellence) appropriate dashboards for performance management by clinical segment To succeed in this role, you’ll need a customer-first attitude and the following High level of energy & drive Passion for Medical Technology Sales & Healthcare. Desired ultrasound background. Analytical (minimum university degree, preferably MBA) Strong ethical track-record Strong proven capability to build teams Understanding of both private & government sales (weight depending on the specific segments How we work at Philips Our newly-adopted hybrid work concept fuses flexibility with collaboration to deliver great outcomes for our people and our customers. We are embracing an approach wherein we spend more time together than apart – which for full-time employees translates to an average of at least 3 days working from the office and up to 2 days from home – for our hybrid roles. Hybrid work flexibility means people can meet the changing demands of work and home in the most balanced, productive, and healthy way. Hybrid work flexibility means people can meet the changing demands of work and home in the most balanced, productive, and healthy way. Our hybrid working model is defined in 3 ways: We believe in the importance of impactful collaboration: There's a certain energy when everyone’s in the same room that can heighten idea generation and creative friction needed for problem-solving. We embrace flexibility: Choosing where, when and how to work can vary according to task and team schedules. Flexibility isn’t office or online, it means choosing the space that works best for you, your teams and our customers on a case-by-case basis. We want to be at our best: The way we work and our workspaces are designed to support our well-being, offer career advancement opportunities, and enable us to be at our best. Why should you join Philips? Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on innovative, customer-first health technology solutions. Help us improve the health and well-being of billions of people, every year. Ultimately creating a career that no one could have planned for. Even you.

Site Name: Singapore - Rochester Park Posted Date: Feb 18 2022 This role manages commercial & GSF (Global Support Function) EHS activities in APAC to mitigate life safety, driver safety risks in Pharma commercial organisation. Providing EHS professional advice to commercial LOCs and WREF. Providing EHS oversight and Independent Business Monitoring for APAC commercial LOCs.  You will be the point of contact of APAC commercial LOCs and GSF, act as a facilitator for commercial EHS projects and activities. Work with global commercial EHS team to ensure establishment of EHS internal control framework in APAC commercial organization. Ensure delivery of an efficient and effective EHS service that meet customer needs and meet required standards, support the local awareness and knowledge development in key technical EHS aspects and management systems. Key Responsibilities Establish and implement commercial EHS internal control framework within APAC commercial organization to ensure compliance with local EHS legislation and GSK global EHSS standards Oversee APAC commercial LOCs EHS governance meeting joint by relevant functions to discuss EHS concerned areas, to prioritize actions and ensure appropriate resources and actions are in place Facilitate EHS risk assessment in APAC commercial LOCs to identify EHS risks in critical areas. Provide expertise on risk mitigation plan development and monitoring actions progress. Ensure robust assessment and control GSK commercial EHSS risks, e.g. life and driver safety, health, and resilience. Facilitate regularly commercial EHS Independent Business Monitoring program to provide EHS monitoring within APAC Commercial LOCs. Build strong relationship and engage/partner with senior commercial leaders, Commercial, Compliance, HR and WREF in APAC to ensure adequate internal control framework had been established to mitigate EHS risks. Work closely with WREF and any associated Business Partner to ensure a safe infrastructure is in place within office environment. Support WREF Real Estate with review of EHS Questionnaire during Lease Renewal/Onboarding and WREF Project Team with Office design, furniture and contractor selection. Work with global Driver Safety project to support project deployment in APAC countries. Monitor Driver Safety progress within LOC and liaison with global Driver Safety lead. Oversee global EHS data reporting system EHS One in APAC commercial organization to ensure data accuracy and support system improvements. Work closely with employee health and wellbeing team and topic specialists and project teams, e.g. Ergonomic, Energy and Resilience to support business needs in commercial businesses in APAC. Basic Qualifications We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals: Degree level (or equivalent) qualifications in a relevant scientific discipline and hold recognised safety qualification Competent and respected EHS practitioner with a highly successful track record (over a period of time) in EHS. Min 5 to 8 years of relevant experiences Experience in commercial BioPharma industry is highly preferred Ability to develop holistic risk assessments, effective management systems, and governance processes at site, country, and regional levels using population level data sets. Ability to work effectively in multicultural, multinational, and matrix teams to consult and embed EHS behavior changes. Ability to grow and sustain personal, team and organizational energy Strong insight driven decision making, using internal and external data to generate options, design solutions, and monitor performance. Good ability to apply knowledge, skills and experience in new situations at sites/locations and businesses that may be new. Experience of applying their skills across a wide number of EHS aspects so they can be highly useful EHS professional across sites and businesses in region Experienced professional who is prepared and able to provide EHS services at numerous levels, to ensure successful deployment of a full range of EHS services across the region and business units in a technically robust and timely way. The professional will need to be able to represent EHS considerations in tough and challenging environments e.g. High-level project meetings. Why GSK At GSK, we have already delivered unprecedented change over the past four years, improving R&D, becoming a leader in Consumer Healthcare, strengthening our leadership, and transforming our commercial execution. Now, we’re making the most significant changes we’ve made to our business in over 20 years. We’re on track to separate and create two new companies in 2022: New GSK with a leading portfolio of vaccines and specialty medicines as well as R&D based on immune system and genetics science; and a new world-leading consumer healthcare company of loved and trusted brands. With new ambition comes new purpose. For New GSK, this is to unite science, talent, and technology to get ahead of disease together – all with the clear ambition of delivering human health impact; stronger and more sustainable shareholder returns; and as a new GSK where outstanding people thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it. How we do all this is through our people and our culture. A culture that is ambitious for patients – so we deliver what matters better and faster; accountable for impact – with clear ownership of goals and support to succeed; and where we do the right thing . So, if you’re ready to improve the lives of billions, join us at this exciting moment in our journey. Join our challenge to get Ahead Together. *LI-GSK Our goal is to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies. We believe that we all bring something unique to GSK and when we combine our knowledge, experiences and styles together, the impact is incredible. Come join our adventure at GSK where you will be inspired to do your best work for our patients and consumers. A place where you can be you, feel good and keep growing.
