Site Name: Singapore - Jurong Posted Date: Feb 18 2022 Are you energized by a highly technical manufacturing support role that allows you to accelerate tech transfer and be part of critical product launches?  If so, this Product Technology Manager role could be an ideal opportunity to explore. As a Product Technology Manager, you will implement and maintain the control strategy for drug substance production. You will be responsible for driving the production process lifecycle management for next generation programs and continuous improvement of commercialized biologics drug substance manufacturing. This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career.  These responsibilities include some of the following: Provide technical support for transfer and manufacture of critical specialty products representing GSK at Contract Manufacturing Organizations (CMOs). Review and accept results from executed batch records and campaign summaries. Assist with identification, resolution and prevention of issues related to product or process technology. Maintain product robustness through ownership of continued process verification plan and periodic product reviews. Support ongoing product supply by ensuring robust and capable processes are in place and monitored. Lead technical impact assessment and support of changes (GSK or CMO driven) including change control and risk assessment. Support execution of validation activities to current standards (e.g. Product Lifecycle Management) in line with GSK QMS. Work with multi-functional teams of Procurement, Quality, Technical, Supply, Project management, Strategy, Regulatory, Finance and Business Development professionals across the Global network. Support key improvement initiatives with GSK's partner organizations on delivery of objectives. Support the implement standards of quality by design into robust manufacturing operations. Support mid-late phase portfolio projects and provide Pharma Supply Chain Technical input into design selection and manufacture considerations. Basic Qualifications: ·        Bachelor's Degree in Chemical/Biochemical Engineering, Biochemistry, Chemistry or equivalent discipline ·        3+ years experience in technical support of biopharmaceutical manufacturing and/or process development ·        Ability to travel up to 15% (domestic and international) Preferred Qualifications: If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus: ·        Demonstrated record of achievement, including ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams ·        Broad and integrated knowledge and experience that can impact project and team direction ·        Experience in technical support of commercial products, program management, technology transfer to commercial manufacturing sites (internal and to external CMO) ·        Experience in process validation, regulatory file preparation, PAI support ·        Technical support of product lifecycle activities (i.e. CPV, PPR, Change and Deviation Management) ·        Excellent verbal and written communication skills ·        Ability to influence, lead and drive change Why GSK Uniting science, talent, and technology to get ahead of disease together At GSK, we have already delivered unprecedented change over the past four years, improving R&D, becoming a leader in Consumer Healthcare, strengthening our leadership, and transforming our commercial execution. Now, we’re making the most significant changes we’ve made to our business in over 20 years. We’re on track to separate and create two new companies in 2022: New GSK with a leading portfolio of vaccines and specialty medicines as well as R&D based on immune system and genetics science; and a new world-leading consumer healthcare company of loved and trusted brands. With new ambition comes new purpose. For New GSK, this is to unite science, talent, and technology to get ahead of disease together – all with the clear ambition of delivering human health impact; stronger and more sustainable shareholder returns; and as a new GSK where outstanding people thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it. How we do all this is through our people and our culture. A culture that is ambitious for patients – so we deliver what matters better and faster; accountable for impact – with clear ownership of goals and support to succeed; and where we do the right thing . So, if you’re ready to improve the lives of billions, join us at this exciting moment in our journey. Join our challenge to get Ahead Together. *Li-GSK Our goal is to be one of the world’s most innovative, best performing and trusted healthcare companies. We believe that we all bring something unique to GSK and when we combine our knowledge, experiences and styles together, the impact is incredible. Come join our adventure at GSK where you will be inspired to do your best work for our patients and consumers. A place where you can be you, feel good and keep growing. Transform the way companies do business and help them achieve their goals. Partner Account Manager, Asia Sales & Business Development | Singapore Our agreement with employees DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agree-able for our employees, customers, and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live. The team Our Sales & Partner Business Development teams collaborate with customers and partners across the globe to help them leverage the DocuSign Agreement Cloud to transform the entire system of agreement process—from preparing to signing, acting on, and managing contracts and other types of agreements. Our team’s partner with some of the largest, most innovative companies in the world in dozens of industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to a small business or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our solutions, and leverage our strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line. This Position The Partner Account Manager for our core ISV partnerships (Microsoft and Salesforce portfolios) in Singapore and Rest of Asia is responsible for consolidating and transforming DocuSign’s ISV License Strategic Partnerships to a scalable growth engine aligned with our corporate priorities. Portfolio focus for this role may include but not limited to Microsoft and Salesforce for this FY. You will work cross-functionally to build a virtual team and processes to support the business and develop successful partnerships. In addition, you will support the other ISV Partner team members working across the ISV ecosystem. Reporting into the APJ Head of Partner Ecosystem ISV, the successful candidate will be a highly motivated, people-oriented, operational and data-savvy leader and a program manager. Responsibilities: Lead and support the overall vision and strategy for DocuSign’s ISV business in Singapore and Rest Of Asia Develop strategic plans to grow the ISV portfolio focused partnerships and DocuSign business in Singapore and Rest of Asia Work closely with our direct sales teams to develop, track, negotiate and close ISV License deals to achieve quarterly targets Leverage on marketing materials and tools from sales enablement team to support the ISV business growth in Japan and train DocuSign sellers and related Service Providers with related practices (Microsoft Salesforce as portfolio focus) Work with the Partner team in Singapore to contribute and foster a One Team ethos Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Business Management or its equivalent 6 – 12 years of experience in Direct or OEM/Channel sales Natural relationship builder with executive level engagement and negotiation skills Proactive, creative and innovative thinker - constantly generate new ideas for driving and supporting divisional priorities Strong capability in networking across the organisation to build and manage a cross-functional virtual team Possess excellent analytical, problem-solving skills and quantitative approach Strong networking and exceptional influencing skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills Self-motivated, organized, detail-oriented, and resourceful Experience with CRM systems and other sales tools Preferred Qualifications Experience selling with, to, through or for Salesforce in the past 5 years Proven track record on mentorship in a partner or sales environment Demonstrated capabilities to leverage cross functional support with Marketing, Operations, Engineering Project management expertise, strong planning and analytical skills Proficiency in Google tools and Salesforce.com Ability to travel as necessary (Typically about 10%) About Us DocuSign® helps organizations connect and automate how they prepare, sign, act on, and manage agreements. As part of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud, DocuSign offers eSignature: the world's #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from almost anywhere, at any time. Today, hundreds of thousands of customers and hundreds of millions of users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people's lives. Plus, we save more trees together! And that’s a good thing. DocuSign is committed to building a diverse team of talented individuals who bring different perspectives to the discussion and who feel a sense of inclusion and belonging when they join our team. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category. #LI-EW1

Manufacturing Engineer 195666BR Manufacturing Engineer Singapore - Marsiling Job Description How Will You Make an Impact? Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue exceeding $40 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, improving patient diagnostics and therapies or increasing productivity in their laboratories, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 100,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services and Patheon. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com What will you do? When you are part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work. Surrounded by collaborative colleagues, you’ll have the support and opportunities that only a global leader can give you. Our respected, growing organization has an exceptional strategy for the near term and beyond. Take your place on our strong team, and help us make significant contributions to the world. Job Responsibilities Assist with all continuous improvement efforts including projects related to cost savings, engineering improvements, and work standardization Support Lean Manufacturing deployment including 5s, audits and dashboard reporting Assist with coordination of projects to ensure project plans are developed and executed. To coordinator and participate in the Gemba Work with cross-function to find a way to improve the current manufacturing process. Ensure process documentation in accordance with Medical Device Directive, GMP- Regulations and FDA Requirements Involving in the PPI process and partnering with Supervisor and manager to find a better way to reduce waster and improve productivity in the manufacturing department. Apply, lead, and teach quality engineering approaches and methods, coaching other team participants. Promote preventive strategies, perform root cause analysis, corrective and preventive actions, process improvement methods, advanced product quality planning, data-driven statistical approaches, and other quality engineering methods to deliver measured results, reducing costs and disruptions of poor quality. Analyze, communicate, and report quality performance at various levels supporting prioritization of projects and achievement of objectives together with teams. How will you get here? Education: Bachelor's degree in Science/Engineering or Diploma in Engineering with 5 year working experience equivalent. Experience: 2 years of Manufacturing and Engineering experience in MNC Competencies Preferred Good problem-solving skills and logical approach to solving problems. Demonstrable interpersonal and communication skills to foster the team environment. Proficient with Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint (Visio and Project a plus). Excellent attention to detail and ability to verify own work for accuracy. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Excellent organizational skills and ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously. Ability to prioritize work with manager input. Ability to escalate decisions as required. Job Category Manufacturing & Production Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

Mfg Equipment Maintenance Technician 194875BR Mfg Equipment Maintenance Technician Singapore - 7 Gul Circle Job Description How Will You Make an Impact? Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO) is the world leader in serving science, with annual revenue of approximately $40 billion. Our Mission is to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. Whether our customers are accelerating life sciences research, solving complex analytical challenges, increasing productivity in their laboratories, improving patient health through diagnostics or the development and manufacture of life-changing therapies, we are here to support them. Our global team of more than 100,000 colleagues delivers an unrivaled combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience and pharmaceutical services through our industry-leading brands, including Thermo Scientific, Applied Biosystems, Invitrogen, Fisher Scientific, Unity Lab Services, Patheon and PPD. For more information, please visit www.thermofisher.com. What will you do? When you are part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work. Surrounded by collaborative colleagues, you’ll have the support and opportunities that only a global leader can give you. Our respected, growing organization has an exceptional strategy for the near term and beyond. Take your place on our strong team, and help us make significant contributions to the world Job Responsibilities Perform assembly and testing of instrument and sub-assemblies in an IS013485 environment. Perform instrument basic troubleshooting, repair, calibration, faulty parts segregation with follow-up activities. Conduct preventive maintenance of fixtures to ensure fixtures are well maintained for manufacturing use Assist Instrument Specialist/Engineers in carrying out validation/evaluations/experiments/troubleshooting. Assist Instrument Specialist/Engineers in improvement projects to enhance productivity. Maintain good housekeeping and safety practices in the production and maintenance support areas. Ensure work performed adhere to ISO 13485:2003 and 21- CFR - 820 requirements Provide feedback and give suggestions to improve instrument stability and performance. Assist new colleagues on their On-the-Job- Training (OJT) by acting as their buddy. Participate and contribute actively in continuous improvement activities Ensure proper documentation and data integrity in JDE system Qualification: Diploma / NITEC in Engineering SPM / O Levels Experience At least 5 years of relevant experience in instruments assembly Knowledge, Skills, Abilities: Willing to learn and positive attitude Team player Working hours: 8am to 5.15pm Working Days : Mondays to Fridays (5 day work week) Job Category Manufacturing & Production Thermo Fisher Scientific is an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.

Job_Title: Manager, Corporate Affairs South East Asia
Job_Descriptions: We currently have an opening for a Corporate Affairs Manager based in our Singapore office. Reporting to Head of Corporate Affairs, South East Asia, Hong Kong and India, you will work closely with cross-functional brand teams and other key stakeholders across the region to support the building of a corporate presence internally and externally. Responsibilities: ·       Develop and execute strategic PR plans supporting brand and corporate comms goals ·       Produce compelling and creative content to boost awareness, educate and engage internal and external audiences ·       Work with cross-cultural teams in local markets across SEA, Hong Kong and India ·       Responsible for both corporate and product communications, issues management, advocacy campaigns, and broader, proactive engagement initiatives ·       Manage foundational PR assets including media lists, coverage and ongoing reports, etc. ·       Foster good relations with media contacts, pitching and securing media opportunities, and measuring impact of media activities ·       Work closely with external PR agencies to manage activities and projects Qualifications: ·       Ability to develop strategic, creative and metrics-driven plans ·       Bachelor’s Degree in English, Journalism, Communications or the equivalent combination of education and experience ·       Outstanding English skills, both oral and written, fluency in Chinese is a bonus ·       Excellent communication, negotiation, forward planning and project management skills. ·       Demonstrated business acumen, strong partnering skills with business leaders. ·       Able to work in complex matrix organizations. Experience: ·       5+ years’ experience in communications, proven track record in brand communications, ideally gained in pharmaceutical or healthcare industry. • Previous experience with international PR agency or (in-house) pharma MNC preferred. ·       Broad communications experience and experienced in working with media. Join Us If you’re seeking a career where you can truly make a difference in the lives of others, a career where you can work at the absolute forefront of biotechnology with the top minds in the field, you’ll find it at Amgen. Amgen, a biotechnology pioneer, discovers, develops and delivers innovative human therapeutics. Our medicines have helped millions of patients in the fight against cancer, kidney disease, rheumatoid arthritis and other serious illnesses. As an organization dedicated to improving the quality of life for people around the world, Amgen fosters an inclusive environment of diverse, ethical, committed and highly accomplished people who respect each other but compete intensely to win. Together, we live the Amgen values as we continue advancing science to serve patients.

Founded in 1999, it started as a small sea sports centre with a beverage kiosk. It was started by an original group of friends known as the Georges brothers. It slowly evolved into a beach bar serving western grill. In the year 2004, Georges expanded inland and nestled itself along East Coast Road. It retained its rustic and beach allure with a Balinese theme. More importantly, it kept its concept of good food, great music, and friendliness. It is a place to meet regulars and make new friends. It is quite true that no one is a stranger @ Georges, and if you are, this is where strangers become friends! Our mission is simple – BE HAPPY. @ georges, we aim to provide a happy place where good food, great music and MAD people meet. Job_Descriptions: Job Description About the company Arte Oro is a jewellery design and manufacturing atelier that aims to provide an extraordinary personal experience of creating one’s very own pieces of bespoke jewellery by translating individual stories into the jewellery. Our involvement throughout the diamond and gem supply chain gives us the global depth and reach to satisfy the most demanding clients in the world. Danilo Giannoni, our Creative Director and Founder of ARTE ORO, started the Singapore-based company in 2017. He brought with him a rich Italian heritage in jewellery making and years of international experiences from Italy, US, Middle East and Hong Kong. Today, besides Singapore, Danilo also has a workshop in Valenza,the world’s “capital” of jewellery making, with over 40 artisans working on design and craft serving European and Middle Eastern clients. We aspire to be the first local atelier attuned to creating “Made in Singapore” custom jewellery and leave a legacy for the next generation of Singaporean. Our goal is not to own the biggest jewellery company in the world, but to have the best atelier for bespoke jewellery in the world. We want you to be part of this journey with us. Superb written and verbal communication skills. Strong time-management skills and the ability to organise and coordinate multiple projects at once. Proficiency in Microsoft Office and other office productivity tools, with aptitude to learn new software and systems. Flexible team player willing to do what it takes to get the job done adaptable and enjoys a challenge. Ability to keep company confidence. Transform the way companies do business and help them achieve their goals. Channel Resell Manager, Asia Sales & Business Development | Singapore Change the way customers and partners live and do business while helping them grow their top and bottom line with our transformative technology. Our agreement with employees DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agree-able for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live. The team Our Sales & Business Development teams collaborate with customers and partners across the globe to help them leverage the DocuSign Agreement Cloud to transform the entire system of agreement process—from preparing to signing, acting on, and managing contracts and other types of agreements. Our team partners with some of the largest most innovative companies in the world in dozens of industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to a small business or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our solutions, and leverage our strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line. This Position As a Channel Resell Manager, you will manage channel reseller partners and distributor partners as a member of the APAC Channel team to drive significant revenue for the region. You will be accountable for exceeding your quarterly revenue quota through net new business as well as from existing customer upsells. This role manages Distributors and channel resell partners in India, Indonesia, and Vietnam. You will create and drive the strategy with the distributors to create programmatic partner recruitment, enablement as well as go to market strategies for 2nd tier partners. You will also be responsible for driving your managed partners in driving pipeline generation programs and executing GTM activities and helping your partner reps resell DocuSign. You have experience working with channel resellers and distributors, understand channel dynamics, and will leverage previous experiences to accelerate your partnerships and grow the region. You are team player and will help and support other team members succeed. This is a great opportunity for an experienced Business Development professional to join a growing channel program or an Account Executive looking to shift to a channel resell role and make a significant impact in the region This position is an Individual Contributor and reports to the APAC Director, Channel Resell. Responsibilities Own and drive relationships with channel reseller and distributor partners in India, Indonesia, Vietnam and other emerging markets to generate significant resell revenue in the region through new customer acquisition and existing customers upsell. Develop partner recruitment, enablement, and GTM plan with distributors across India, Indonesia, and Vietnam. Develop GTM plans with managed partners to achieve and exceed revenue targets. Execute GTM activities and lead cross functional teams on activities such as onsite trainings, email campaigns, remote training sessions, webinars, and events. Generate resold revenue and assist partner sales teams to close deals. Manage pipeline generation and revenue forecast reporting. Leverage existing relationships at partners to influence decision makers, increase mindshare, and accelerate engagement from partners. Assist partners with product positioning, configuration, demonstrations, sales strategy, and closing deals. Forge strong DocuSign-internal relationships with key managers and support organizations in a dynamic and growing environment to ensure the right people and connected at the right time. Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Business Management or its equivalent 5 – 10 years of channel or direct sales experience in a Channel Account Executive role or a quota-carrying equivalent role Visionary mindset with strong focus on execution Hardworking, Initiative with a go-getter work attitude Excellent written and verbal communication and time management skills Ability to work in a fast-paced changing environment Team player who can collaborate across the org with various departments 25% or more on necessary travel depending on territory/region coverage Preferred Qualifications 2 years of experience in a SaaS company, preferably in a Sales, Business Development or Marketing role Additional Language skills will be an advantage About Us DocuSign® helps organizations connect and automate how they prepare, sign, act on, and manage agreements. As part of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud, DocuSign offers eSignature: the world's #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from almost anywhere, at any time. Today, hundreds of thousands of customers and hundreds of millions of users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people's lives. Plus, we save more trees together! And that’s a good thing. DocuSign is committed to building a diverse team of talented individuals who bring different perspectives to the discussion and who feel a sense of inclusion and belonging when they join our team. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category. #LI-EW1

We are driving a revolution! Today, Bitstamp is one of the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchanges and a cornerstone of the global crypto market. Our ambition is to expand our business and brand even further, and we are looking for innovative, ambitious and passionate people to be part of this story in Singapore. We believe that the promise of crypto – and the decentralisation of finance – should be a movement open to everyone. If this strikes a chord with you – then join us to make a difference. We are seeking a dynamic and ambitious Regional Marketing Manager to help drive Bitstamp’s growth strategy in Asia Pacific. You’ll be empowered to drive Bitstamp’s marketing program within the region, working in collaboration with our truly global marketing team and various marketing agencies. Join the world’s longest-running cryptocurrency exchange as we ramp up our APAC presence. What you’ll be doing : Play an integral part in shaping our growth strategy by developing and driving fully integrated marketing campaigns in APAC. Own the sponsorship and proprietary events program across the region. Collaborate with global teams to localise the delivery of brand, Social & Paid media, Influencer, and Affiliate marketing programs. Campaign manage global campaigns driving from the APAC business with support from the global marketing team. Work with Business Development to co-deliver structured sales enablement and lead generation activities. Own campaign performance reporting, value attribution and optimisation recommendations. Who we’re looking for : 3-5 years in a marketing role. Minimum of 3 years in event management (in-house or agency). Financial Services, Tech Services, or Professional Services industry experience. Experience managing regional campaigns across APAC is highly desirable. Strong in project management skills and attention to detail. Creative thinker that can challenge the status quo. Passion for cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology  is desirable. Commercially minded and independent team player. A passion to make their mark in the industry. We have become the world’s longest-running cryptocurrency exchange by building a talented team of people who enjoy working together and are dedicated to supporting each other’s growth. If you want to join a fast-paced company in a highly innovative industry and if you find it exciting to contribute to Bitstamp's next chapter, in a time where crypto will become mainstream – come and join the team!

Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek -- so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com. As an Intern, you will your function specific sophomore year coursework to a variety of focused hands-on projects. At the same time, you will gain and knowledge about Agilent's industry, infrastructure and products in your assignment. This is developing real world experience in a company that is a leader in the markets it serves. The student, under the supervision of a Manufacturing or Material Engineer, will engage in hands-on experiments with the latest Agilent LC-MS technology and Automation Systems. In this internship, the student will be exposed with: Various Products in Automation Solution Business, in particular the Bravo System. Plastic molding processes and pipette tips design Manufacturing environment and processes for the Liquid Chromatography-Mass Spectrometry (LCMS) instrument. Candidates will: Support pipette tips output expansion program and achieve timely completion of milestones. Research on the topic of sterilization of tips and its impact. Assist in evaluation of First Article samples and compilation of reports. Troubleshoot manufacturing issues and provide recommendations on resolutions. Support Process & Workflow optimization for Final Assembly, Mechanical Inspection & Final test. Requirements: Bachelor in Mechanical Engineering from Local University Knowledge in Plastic moulding will be an added advantage. Knowledge in GMP and process/workflow optimization and standardization. Responsible, self-motivated, able to multi-task and work under tight timelines. Able to work independently and loves working in a team. Applicable to the local University student who is looking for industrial attachment Internship period from January 2022 to March 2022 (20 weeks) Agilent Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other protected categories under all applicable laws.

Hiring_Company: NATIONAL CANCER CENTRE OF SINGAPORE PTE LTD
Job_Descriptions: We would like to recruit a Research Officer/Technologist to join our group that focuses on translational cancer research projects at the National Cancer Centre Singapore. Our research group focuses on the early detection of cancer, in collaboration with clinicians and scientists from other institutions. Our team aims to discover genetic changes or other biomarkers associated with cancer that could potentially be helpful for the early detection of cancer. Your responsibilities will include: - Design and perform wet bench work such as the processing of blood samples, cell culture and molecular biology experiments, including data interpretation and record keeping. - Contribute to the preparation of manuscripts, grant proposals and reports. - Lab management, including lab safety, lab maintenance and procurement of lab supplies. - Perform other duties as assigned by the Principal Investigator. Requirements: - Diploma in Medical Sciences or Biotechnology, or BSc in Life Sciences, Genomics, Genetics, Molecular Biology or Cancer Biology. - Must be extremely organised, meticulous and patient. - Must have experience working in the laboratory and good bench skills. - Must be passionate about biomedical research, highly self-motivated, keen to learn and able to work independently. - Strong interpersonal skills and a team player. - Good communication and writing skills. - Proficiency in MS Office. Additional Requirements (preferred): - Experience in genomics, genetics, molecular biology, cell culture. - Publications in genetics, genomics or molecular biology. Publications in cancer research will be an added advantage. - Experience in handling of biological materials from patients will be an advantage. If you are interested in this position, please submit your detailed curriculum vitae which includes the names and e-mail addresses of 3 academic referees .

Job_Title: Head, Special Projects and Business Impact
Job_Descriptions: About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities Standard Chartered Bank (SCB) has a bold ambition to be the number one learning function in the financial services: “having world-class learning that unlocks the unique potential of our people and helps them contribute their best to Standard Chartered and our clients, both today and as we transform into the future”. To achieve this ambition, the People Capability function has reinvented its organisation design to organise around Hives, Disciplines and Squads. In this model: Multi-disciplinary “Squads’’ deliver work to achieve the function’s priorities. Squads are comprised of practitioners from different Disciplines, with different skills, levels of expertise and backgrounds. “Priorities” are the way in which work is organised and relate to unique areas of delivery. Squads delivering on different projects within the same strategic priority are grouped together and called “Hives’’. All Squad members are “Discipline’’ practitioners and are dynamically allocated to Squads through Disciplines: Disciplines are the ‘homes’ for practitioners to develop their professional excellence and to maintain a common approach to similar activities and tasks. They provide a stable community for practitioners to belong to (as people move across Squads). They enable multi-skilling and development of depth and breadth or “T-shaped” capabilities. Currently, there are three Disciplines within People Capability: Innovation and Insight: Applying a research based and future focused approach which identifies marketplace stories of transformation and innovation underpinned by analysis of trends and insights that enriches and challenges all strategic discussions on our vision, priorities and practices. Learning Technology: Designing an omnichannel architecture and experience through careful integration of digital learning technology platforms, tools and experiential practices which enable the design of challenging, creative and impactful learning experiences. Creative and Delivery: Bringing the best stories of learning experiences into the design and delivery of human centred, business critical and commercially viable solutions that make real-world impact and behavioural/ skill changes for our workforce. Strategic importance of role The People Capability function has concluded a significant transformation to modernise the function and deliver learning more efficiently and effectively for our stakeholders. The learning transformation ultimately aims to realise our vision to be the number one learning organization in financial services. The Head Special Projects and Business Impact role enables the transformation to have the desired impact across the organisation. The role holder will firstly work with the Global Head of People Capability and the other members of the PCMT on a small number of high priority projects which will drive the greatest business impact across the learning portfolio. They will ensure that the PC delivers to the highest possible quality, creativity and efficiency standards and play a central role in designing the solutions in partnership with a squad and product owners/other business sponsors. The role holder will also play a strong role in governance, supporting the Head of People Capability and PCMT in creating, developing or delivering on the learning agendas as defined in partnership with the Learning Councils. Crucially, the role holder will create and maintain strong relationships between PC and the HR and broader business community across SCB, such that our learning agendas are shared and visible. What the role does Special Projects leadership works with the Learning Councils and PCMT to identify a small number of high impact projects to take an active role in brings the best of PC and business support to those projects, ensuring the highest standards of quality and scale Actively collaborates across the squad(s) to enhance our relationships across SCB Business Impact Governance works across the Global Learning Council and other Learning Councils to create an integrated and transparent suite of learning agendas Works closely before and after the councils with the business sponsors to ensure visibility and shared ownership of learning priorities and learning capacity Works closely with PCMT and Head of Governance to align budget, governance and sprint cycles. Regulatory and business conduct Displays exemplary conduct and lives by the Group’s Values and Code of Conduct. Takes personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Effectively and collaboratively identifies, escalates, mitigates and resolves risk, conduct and compliance matters. Key Stakeholders Global Head of People Capability Head Discipline & Asia (Innovation and Insight), People Capability Head Discipline (Learning Technology), People Capability Head Discipline & Europe / Americas (Creative and Delivery), People Capability Head Hives Today (Non-Mandatory), People Capability Head Hives Today (Mandatory), People Capability Head Hives Tomorrow (Reskilling Strategy), People Capability Head Hives Beyond and Africa and Middle East Region, People Capability Key Performance Indicators Clear shared ownership and endorsement of learning agendas Delivery of business impact through special projects using agreed metrics, eg speed to value, customer retention etc Our Ideal Candidate The role holder requires an individual who understands and can support the development and delivery of a strategic HR and learning agenda. They should be able to bring in and co-create solutions with Business Sponsors and Product Owners and maintain strong and strategic communication channels with critical stakeholders. They should also be able to step in and lead a small number of high impact projects from ideation to delivery, leading a squad, advising on learning design and bringing the business along as we develop the solutions. The role holder should be: 10+ years of experience across HR A leader in enterprise-wide agile, able to support on the agile leadership model; Strong strategic partner; able to understand the HR and business perspectives and to integrate them into the PC agenda strong commercial acumen; supporting the creation of our projects with the biggest business impact Role Specific Technical Competencies HR and business agenda alignment Agile project management Design prototyping and experimentation Data literacy Horizon scanning Business acumen People Capability expertise, knowledge and experience in one or more of the disciplines – e.g. Insight and Opportunities/ Learning Technology/ Creative and Delivery Knowledge and experience in emerging learning solutions incorporating including on-demand platform delivered learning, social, experiential and virtual / interactive learning HR / Talent Data analytics & measurement /business intelligence capability Collaboration Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.

About Syngenta : Syngenta is one of the world’s leading agriculture innovation company (Part of 23 Billion USD Syngenta Group) dedicated to improve global food security by enabling millions of farmers to make better use of available resources. Through world class science and innovative crop solutions, our 28,000 people in over 90 countries are working to transform how crops are grown. We are committed to rescuing land from degradation, enhancing biodiversity and revitalizing rural communities. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture. Our employees reflect the diversity of our customers, the markets where we operate and the communities which we serve. No matter what your position, you will have a vital role in safely feeding the world and taking care of our planet. Role Purpose Our APAC Digital Marketing Lead will be motivated to work on innovative solutions and communications that influence millions of farmers across Asia Pacific, helping them address the effects of climate change and evolve with the ever-changing agricultural landscape. You will lead cross-functional task forces to realise this vision. You will provide project leadership and execution support to build world class digital marketing capabilities across the organisation. You will enjoy rolling up your sleeves to lead hands-on implementation, testing and iteration of digital initiatives including selecting and measuring all relevant KPIs. You have a deep curiosity and passion to solve business challenges with facts and data. You are resilient and have a drive to seize opportunities. You will collaborate cross-functionally to reach our farmers at scale with relevant and timely communication using multiple tools across multiple digital touch points. Our team collaborates with innovative and talented engineers, designers, business teams and growers, to assist in the design and development of technologies that will benefit both internal stakeholders and external customers. By spanning the technical and business teams, you will have visibility and influence to help guide digital marketing solutions from conception to launch The role will function as the regional digital centre of excellence to drive best practices across digital marketing and marketing technologies. Employee may, as part of his/her role and maybe through multifunctional teams, participate in the creation and design of innovative solutions. In this context, Employee may contribute to inventions, designs, other work product, including know-how, copyrights, software, innovations, solutions, and other intellectual assets. Job_Title: Associate, CFCC Advisory, CCIB Client Coverage
Job_Descriptions: About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities Strategy Support the implementation of the vision, strategy, direction and for CCIB Client Coverage CFCC Advisory teams, consistent with Global Head, CFCC Advisory, CCIB Client Coverage’s vision and strategy for the CCIB Client Coverage CFCC team and the strategy of the CFCC function as a whole, and in support of the Bank’s strategic direction and growth aspirations. Promote the culture and practice of compliance with compliance standards (including conducting business within regulatory requirements, and to high ethical standards) within the Bank and embed a Here for good culture and the Group Code of Conduct. Business Build and maintain an effective and constructive relationship with all key business and functional stakeholders, that is based on trust, capability and integrity, providing timely, responsive and quality regulatory compliance advice and guidance to enable the business and functions to meet / achieve their strategic tactical objectives. Work closely with the functions to provide timely regulatory compliance advice to ensure compliance with all relevant laws and regulations and support the transition to pro-active and pre-emptive compliance and conduct risk mitigation. Support the team in providing challenge to relevant function stakeholders where activities are outside risk tolerance/ appetite, escalating as necessary, until appropriate oversight and ownership is achieved including actions and plans to address any remedial action needed to come back within risk tolerance/ appetite. Support the provision of timely regulatory compliance advice to ensure compliance with all relevant laws and regulations and support the transition to pro-active and pre-emptive compliance and conduct risk mitigation. Processes Support processes (including training, advice and support) to ensure that policies, procedures and standards to address compliance risks (excluding financial crime) are effectively implemented and adhered to across CCIB Client Coverage (of which all references shall also include products/services such as Correspondent Banking, Lending, Mergers & Acquisitions and ESG Advisory), Credit Portfolio Management and GSAM. Pro-active identification of risks and concerns, including escalation to all relevant stakeholders. Timely mitigation and resolution of risks and issues, establishments of effective controls, in collaboration with all relevant stakeholders. Risk Management Support Risk Owner under the Group’s Risk Management Framework for CCIB Client Coverage, Credit Portfolio Management and GSAM processes where CFCC is the second line Risk Owner. Ensure effective management of compliance matters, and in collaboration with the rest of the CFCC teams, effectively manage regulatory issues that have a significant impact on the Bank. In the event of serious regulatory breaches, or where risk tolerances have been breached, ensure senior management in the Bank and relevant regulators are informed and that actions are taken quickly to remediate and/or activities are ceased. Support the proactive and timely identification, assessment, advice and dissemination of evolving regulatory changes/practices and associated risks, and support engagements in regulatory reform. Assist and work closely with Shared Investigative Services (SIS) and Surveillance and Monitoring teams in relation to investigations and breaches concerning the relevant businesses Support in ensuring that global standards are understood and implemented, with any identified exceptions, or need for more/less stringent standards escalated to senior CFCC Management for joint decision-making. Maintain adequate management MI / trackers across all aspects of their coverage and responsibility to ensure all issues and matters are tracked, followed, regularly assessed and reported on. Governance Awareness and understanding of the regulatory framework, in which the Group operates, and the regulatory requirements and expectations relevant to the role. Within the Group's overall Risk Management Framework, support the establishment and maintenance of appropriate risk based compliance frameworks for identifying, assessing, managing, monitoring, mitigating and reporting compliance (including regulatory and financial crime) risks across the relevant businesses. Support the development and assist in recommendation (for approval by the relevant Risk Committee), appropriate compliance policies and procedures. Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Contribute by supporting the CCIB Client Coverage CFCC Advisory team to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank’s Conduct Principles: Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Financial Markets; Financial Crime Compliance; and The Right Environment. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Key Stakeholders CCIB Client Coverage COO teams (including Integrated Middle Office and Client Lifecycle Design Management teams) FI Strategic Enablement team M&A team Sustainable Finance team Lending product team Credit Portfolio Management team CCIB CFCC (Group, Region and Country) CCIB Client Coverage Legal Responsibility & Sustainability Risk GSAM Policy and Performance team Group Credit Risk Group Operational Risk Group Internal Audit CFCC Centres of Expertise Other Responsibilities Embed Here for good and Group’s brand and values in CCIB Client Coverage CFCC Advisory Team. Perform other responsibilities assigned under Group, Country, Business or Functional policies and standards. Our Ideal Candidate University Graduate or equivalent degree preferred 2+ years working in Financial Institutions with Compliance or Financial Crime expertise either gathered directly through roles in Compliance , Financial Crime, Risk or equivalent Control Functions Ability to foster positive relationships with internal and external stakeholders at appropriate level ensuring open collaborative environment Business Acumen Business Ethics CFCC Risk Type Advisory Cross-functional Collaboration Managing Change Organizational Governance Regulatory Environment - Financial Services Risk Management Planning: Tactical, Strategic Data gathering and reporting Role Specific Technical Competencies Compliance Financial crime Risk & Controls Management Organizational Governance Regulatory Environment - Financial Services Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.

Hiring_Company: GERMAN EUROPEAN SCHOOL SINGAPORE (DEUTSCHE EUROPAEISCHE SCHULE SINGAPUR)
Job_Descriptions: Start Date - 1st August 2022 The German European School Singapore (GESS) is looking for an experienced Head of Mathematics for Grades 6-12 covering the IB Curriculum (MYP and/or DP). As a Head of the Mathematics department your primary role is to provide academic leadership. The Head of Subject is intended to be the ´primus inter pares´ of the subject team. The key responsibilities are to implement curriculum, pedagogical and assessment developments in accordance with the IB Standards and Practices and the IB coordinators leadership. You are responsible for contributing to a vibrant GESS community through events and programmes and furthermore you have responsibilities for logistical resource management and coordination with the student support services. In your teaching commitment at GESS, you will need to take on the following responsibilities where you will be expected to: · Develop a strong relationship with all parents and students · Be a role model who mentors and guides students to ensure they meet their full potential · Actively review student assessment data, including academic, behavioral and social/emotional, to set learning goals, develop student agency and put in place interventions to ensure successful learning of each individual Experience and Qualifications · Recognised teaching qualification (minimum B.Ed or PGCE equivalent) · At least 8 years teaching experience · At least 2 years experience in an academic or departmental leadership capacity · Knowledge, understanding and teaching experience of the IB Middle Years Programme (MYP) and IB Diploma Programme (DP) · Ability to work collaboratively, professionally and effectively within a team · Experience of working in an international school setting advantageous · Willingness to adapt to and embrace a new school environment · Willingness to contribute and champion educational change that supports best practice and improve student learning Professional Expertise · Professional Knowledge: The applicant has a deep understanding of the curriculum, subject content, and the developmental needs of students and can effectively provide relevant learning experiences. · Instructional Planning: The applicant can plan using aspects of student data to inform learning outcomes, emphasizes linking concepts and building upon skills, and focuses on identifying relationships between objectives. · Instructional Delivery: The applicant can use a variety of research based instructional strategies relevant to the content area to engage students in active learning, to promote key skills, and to meet individual learning needs. · Assessment for Learning: The applicant can effectively use differentiated assessment tools and strategies and understands how to make accommodations for individual students’ needs. · Learning Environment: The applicant has a clear understanding of the importance of establishing routines and procedures and of providing, safe, supportive, student-centered environment. He/she involves families and other educators when needed. · Professionalism: The applicant is committed to professional ethics, international-mindedness, and the school’s mission; collaborates and communicates appropriately; and takes responsibility for professional growth that results in the enhancement of student learning. · Student Progress: The work of the applicant will result in acceptable, measurable, and appropriate student progress. Leadership Competencies Professionalism School leaders develop a school culture that fosters and values professional learning. They recognise that they need to build individual and institutional knowledge and understanding so that schools continue to grow as places where knowledge and meaning is discovered and constructed. Innovation School leaders expect change and respond in creative, analytical and practical ways. They demonstrate the ability to innovate, develop, communicate, promote and evaluate new ideas and practices, take intellectual risks and support others in these endeavors. Organisation School leaders think logically and form an inference based on experience to find the best solutions. They have the capacity to reflect and are adaptable to new settings. They can make quick decisions and rapid judgments with the big picture in mind. Strategic School leaders are forward thinking, see the bigger picture, recognize emerging trends and translate strategy into action while aligning people and organization behind a set of shared values and vision. Personnel management School leaders exert influence on individuals, groups, and systems to achieve a goal or set of goals. They understand stakeholders and support them to achieve their optimum. School leaders support others to work together to achieve better outcomes for students. Keen to collaborate and share your specialist expertise, you will be a fitting ambassador for the school. You will communicate with confidence across diverse audiences and situations, using your expertise to build strong relationships across the GESS community.

patients. · To schedule patients appointment/admission for lung Function Tests and Sleep Monitoring Studies. · To actualize patient’s admission and perform a “discharge” in SAP before and after Sleep Monitoring Studies accordingly. · To check and calibrate equipment/ emergency trolley and instruments To ensure that they are in good working condition. · To perform Lung Function Tests and Sleep Monitoring Studies as requested Respiratory Physician according To hospital standards of operation. · To provide appropriate instructions To patient for follow-up review at Specialist Clinic. · To An Accounts Officer will fully support the Accounts function within the Finance department through the development and processing of accurate reports and account management. What will I be doing? As Accounts Officer, you will fully support the Accounts function within the Finance department through the development and processing of accurate reports and account management, and monitor all transactions as they contribute to or detract hotel revenue. Specifically, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards: - Carry out daily checks of revenue figures, supporting reports and vouchers. - Reconcile and verify that all revenue sources are accurately posted, and resolve any identified discrepancies. - Ensure daily and monthly revenue and settlement reconciliation is prepared on a timely basis. - Review Upselling Incentives - Reconcile and audit changes, discrepancies, corrections, voids, discounts, rebates, paid-out, house use, and complimentary use, gifts vouchers etc. and ensure accountability accordingly to hotel standard operating procedures. - Prepare daily Accounts Receivable work, including Direct Bills, Group Bills, Rooms and Food & Beverage charges. - Resolves inquiries related to Direct Bill by conducting thorough research. - Investigate credit card chargebacks, and resolve guest enquiries. - Perform control checks as mandated by Hilton's policies and procedures and SOX requirements. - Support in the development of the Finance team and other roles that may interact with financial processes to help provide the hotel with a multi-skilled team - Execute on tasks/requests as instructed by the Finance Manager and/or General Manager What are we looking for? An Accounts Officer serving Hilton brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviours, skills, and values that follow: - Previous experience in a high volume Accounts function - Computer literate, with good MS Excel skills - Good time management and organisation skills - High-level of attention to detail and accuracy - Ability to develop strong working relationships with internal and external customers It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions: - Previous Accounts experience, preferably within a hotel environment - Relevant degree or diploma, in Accounting or related business discipline, from an academic institution

Job_Descriptions: Overview SAP Fiori/PO Engineer is responsible for techno-functional development and support of the SAP Fiori/PO applications & system. He/she needs to collaborate with SAP functional, Technical and Business Users to develop business requirements, and document technical requirements, and to participate in implementation projects and provide post-implementation support and maintenance. Job Description SAP Fiori/PO Engineer’s primary objective is helping businesses implement technology solutions on SAP Fiori/PO, SAP BTP, SAP Cloud Connector, SAP Web Dispatcher, development in a cost-effective way by accurately determining and understanding the requirements of business users in an IT projects & enhancements, and communicating them clearly to stakeholders, facilitators and partners. They collaborate with vendors, project team and business users to develop and document technical & functional design, participate in implementation and provide post-implementation support. They are required to ensure that the SAP systems and applications operate reliably and efficiently. SAP Fiori/PO Engineer would typically be knowledgeable about processes and practices in the business domain to which the IT system is to be deployed. In performing the role, SAP Fiori/PO Engineer is expected to do the following: Follow the SAP best practice and coding standard Propose the effective technical and functional solution Impact analysis for the change request & enhancements Functional design Technical design Development & bug fixes Work with other teams to perform system integration test Support user acceptance test Go-live preparation and support Post implementation support Work with others to prepare requests for proposals and participate all necessary meetings to facilitate selection of project services, solution and products Qualifications The candidate is expected to possess the following expertise: Degree or Diploma in Information Technology or Computer Science, or related disciplines conferred by a recongnised Education Institution. High Proficiency in SAP Fiori/PO, SAP BTP, SAP Cloud Connector, SAP Web Dispatcher.At least 3 or more years of experience in the above mentioned areas. Must have integration knowledge and implementation experience with SAP ECC 6, and SAP S/4HANA Systems, and SAP Successfactors, REST APIs such as OData etc. Good to have integration knowledge and implementation experience with Non-SAP Systems such as OutSystems will be an add-on advantage. Strong ABAP programming skills. Sound knowledge and experiences in Hana XS Engine, HANA CDS Views, HANA SDI, Odata, SQL, and HANA Enterprise will be an add-on advantage. Sound knowledge of SAP S/4Hana or ECC6.0 functional modules such as FICO, SD, MM. Strong analytical and good troubleshooting skills Has initiative to drive to succeed, able to work independently and as a team

Job_Title: Strategic Insights and Business Analytics Manager
Job_Descriptions: We’re JTI, Japan Tobacco International and we believe in freedom. We think that the possibilities are limitless when you’re free to choose. In fact, we’ve spent the last 20 years innovating, creating new and better products for our consumers to choose from. It’s how we’ve grown to be present in 130 countries. But our business isn’t just business. Our business is our people. Their talent. Their potential. We believe when they’re free to be themselves, grow, travel, and develop, amazing things can happen for our business. That’s why our employees, from around the world, choose to be a part of JTI. It’s why 9 out of 10 would recommend us to a friend . And why we’ve been awarded Global Top Employer status, six years running. So when you’re ready to choose a career you’ll love, in a company you’ll love, feel free to #JoinTheIdea. (Learn more: jti.com) WHAT THIS POSITION IS ABOUT - PURPOSE: The role will be responsible for the overall management of Strategic Insights and Business Analytics for JT International Singapore Pte Ltd to gain an in-depth knowledge of the market, trade, and consumers, and thereby support the strategic decision making for the business. WHAT WILL YOU DO - RESPONSIBILITIES: Market Performance Tracking & Analysis: - Manage the Nielsen Retail Audit data delivery and reports in line with regional requirements through close collaboration with Nielsen and GBS. - Analyze key trends, identify portfolio gaps and opportunities, and share insights with key stakeholders. Quantitative Research: - Lead quantitative studies to monitor overall market dynamics such as brand performance, perception, consumer behavior, pricing elasticity, etc. Qualitative Research: - Lead qualitative studies to gain an in-depth understanding of categories and consumers, address specific business questions and test new concepts. - Define the best methodology and sampling to uncover meaningful insights. Market Modelling & Forecast: - Support 3-year business planning based on industry and segment forecast on commercial KPIs. - Monitor key economic indicators as well as FMCG/retail trends to develop a more robust outlook of the industry. Budget Management : - Lead budget negotiations and annual contracts with research agencies, to optimize SI/BA investment while ensuring high-quality service delivery. WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR - REQUIREMENTS: University degree or equivalent Minimum of 5 years of experience in marketing research in either research agency or FMCG company or both. Open also if the candidate is from Manufacturing or Retail business Fluent in oral and written English Experience in using Power BI and/or Nielsen Answers Good presentation skills being able to engage with senior management Good knowledge of retail audit analytics as well as market research methodologies Ability to think high-level strategy and collaborate with various business functions to generate actionable insights Experience in market modelling and volume forecast preferred Industry knowledge a plus

COMPANY DESCRIPTION The EtonHouse International Education Group is headquartered in Singapore with 100 schools in over 11 countries. Together these schools provide high quality education to over 15000 children globally. EtonHouse has been at the forefront of international education offering innovative pre-schools and K-12 schools across Asia. In the early years, an inquiry-based “Inquire-Think-Learn” curriculum, inspired by the Reggio Emilia approach is followed. In the primary, secondary and high school, EtonHouse offers the globally recognized International Baccalaureate (IB) Programme and IGCSE qualifications. There are 9 IB schools in the EtonHouse family. RESPONSIBILITIES Work directly with children in the Secondary years, developing a Mathematics curriculum together with the team. Assist in communication with current parents as required. Respect and value each child’s social, cultural and religious background and by example, provide mutual respect and tolerance. Share in the management of pastoral care, health, welfare and behaviour of all pupils and in particular, those within your designated class group. Undertake the teaching of a class in accordance with the school’s agreed policies and guidelines. Use a variety of appropriate teaching and caring methods to ensure high quality learning takes place. Maintain professional dialogue with colleagues concerning the children, other colleagues and the school. Treat all information with confidentiality. Ensure the provision of equal opportunities for all. Encourage children to take pride in their own environment and show respect and concern for others, to the benefit of the school as a caring community. This Role We are seeking a Data Engineer to support the Portfolio Manager at Schonfeld in Singapore. What you'll do Your responsibilies and duties include: design and implement database storage and visualization system source data from different providers, maintain database and integrate database with other applications such as the trading system develop, maintain and enhance robust applications processing high volumes of intraday data develop Excel/VBA applications such as trading spreadsheet work with other team members on implied volatility surface database work with other team members to develop new quantitative models close collaboration with researchers and traders to fix issues in real-time trading, deliver root cause analysis and improve performance What you'll bring Master’s degree in mathematics, computer science or scientific computing; at least 5-year working experience in data engineering/quantitative analysis or other related fields. Proficient in Python, C++, familiar with Java, SQL, Excel/VBA Experience in building data storage system such as Hadoop, in bash shell scripting for real-time trading data, in database scripting/visualization tools such as SQL, PowerBI, Tableau or Dash and in using Bloomberg terminal/API Understanding financial derivatives such as options and delta hedging, algorithm performance measurement/improvement, cloud computing and parallel computing Some knowledge on Fixed income, FX and commodity is a plus We'd love you have Must be a team player with good communication skills, able to communicate complex topics to both tech and non-tech people Must be able to work well under pressure Willingness to learn new knowledge and dive into new fields Our Culture The firm’s ethos is embedded in our people. ‘Talent is our strategy’ is our mantra and drives how we approach all initiatives at the firm. We believe our success is because of our people, so putting our talent above all else is our top priority. Schonfeld strives to create an environment where our people can thrive. We foster a teamwork-oriented, collaborative environment where ideas at any level are encouraged and shared. The development and advancement of our talent is honed through interactions with each other, learning & educational offerings, and through opportunities to make impactful contributions. At Schonfeld, we strive to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout all of our employees with Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at the forefront of this mission. As a firm we are committed to creating a hiring process which is not only fair, but also welcoming and supportive. On a daily basis, our employees welcome diversity across identity, thought, people and views which serves as the foundation of our culture and success. You can learn more about our DEI initiatives here - Belonging @ Schonfeld. Who we are Schonfeld Strategic Advisors is a multi-manager platform that invests its capital with Internal and Partner portfolio managers, primarily on an exclusive or semi-exclusive basis, across quantitative, fundamental equity and tactical trading strategies. We have created a unique structure to provide global portfolio managers with autonomy, flexibility and support to best enable them to maximize the value of their businesses. Over the last 30 years, Schonfeld has successfully capitalized on inefficiencies and opportunities within the equity markets. We have developed and invested heavily in proprietary technology, infrastructure and risk analytics. Our portfolio exposure has expanded across the Americas, Europe and Asia as well as multiple asset classes and products.

Job_Title: BILLING EXECUTIVE, REGISTRY SERVICES (2-year contract position)
Location: Supreme Court Lane, Downtown Core, Singapore, 179803, Central Region, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Job Description The Singapore Academy of Law (“SAL”) is a promotion and development agency for Singapore’s legal industry. Our vision is to make Singapore the legal hub of Asia. The Singapore Mediation Centre (“SMC”) is a subsidiary of the Academy. Established in 1997, SMC pioneered the use of mediation as the mainstream mechanism for dispute resolution, as well as training in negotiation and conflict management. Today, SMC offers a suite of alternative dispute resolution services which brings clarity and objectivity to complex situations. These services include mediation, adjudication, neutral evaluation and domain name dispute resolution. Through our panel of professional mediators with legal and industry expertise, SMC is well-placed to manage difficult negotiations and unlock standstills for businesses by providing cost-effective and timely solutions. At SMC, our vision is to help all businesses fully appreciate the value of mediation as a strategic risk-management tool that they can count on in commercial dealings. Responsibilities: You will support the administration of cases by managing the financial aspects of case files that are administered by SMC’s Registry team. This includes, but not limited to, SMC’s core services for Mediation and Adjudication. You will require familiarity with using SMC’s inhouse enterprise resource planning software – Business Central – to create customer cards, input data and generate invoicing (including e-invoicing) for case files. You will be required to liaise closely with the Finance department on invoicing, receipts, and other financial aspects between SMC’s Registry team and the Finance department. You may also be required to undertake other ad hoc duties in relation to the financial aspects of case files as and when required (e.g. collection and dispatch of cheques/documents). Requirements: Have familiarity with Business Central and MS Office. Be meticulous and organized, possess initiative, and are able to multitask to meet deadlines. Preferably have work experience related to Finance and/or Accounting. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
